Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: pateenas
Reviews.Content: Loved staying here,handy to shopping,train station across the road,very central to everything,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lairoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a family room on the 14th floor overlooking Hyde Park room 146 was excellent. Continental Breakfast supplied cereal,milk,juice,fruit,toast and spreads really good value rooms cleaned daily by excellent staff the reception staff could not be faulted will definately stay here again. I have never stayed in a hotel where i could say all the staff were of the highest quality well done guys they went out of their way to make you feel welcome I arrived on an early flight and was taken to a day room with tv,couches,tea/coffee whilst waiting for my room thanks again. Free carparking was a bonus as was the breakfast so we didnt have to rush around in the morning looking for somewhere to get something to eat. Small kitchenette but enough to do what we wanted. The view overlooking the park and harbour was nice to view when you wake up in the morning.Visited Sydney with 4 young adults but the room was still spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: happymoEssexGirl
Reviews.Content: After being in transit for 23.5 hours, we got to the hotel at 10.45am, although we we not allowed into the room before 2pm, the reception staff were so helpful, they allowed us up to the room to shower and unpack. The room itself had a balcony overlooking Hyde Park and the Anzac Memorial. It was clean, a good size and very comfortable. The hotel itself was within walking distance of the city, Circular Quay,Darling Harbour so had no need for transport to go anywhere- From the airport we just got onto the Metro and got off where the Hotel was right opposite the station-perfect, no waiting for airport shuttles or expensive taxis-We would not hesitate to stay there again and at $170 AUD it was a good price for the position of the hotel-

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: suehay61
Reviews.Content: I booked a family room as there were 4 of us having a reunion.Room was a recently refurbished room very tastefully done,was on the 13th floor so noise wasn't a problem.The hotel is right across the street from museum train station so very easy to get to from airport and very convenient for travel around the city.Most things only a short walk away,pitt st mall,darling harbour,opera house.The room was clean and the staff were helpful,I would definitely stay again when visiting sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy hotel, unhelpful staff, cleaners left room door open and unlocked while we were out.”
Reviews.Author: Voyagetripper
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a great location but was dirty and tired looking. I agree with other comments that it is definitely more like a backpackers than a hotel. Also not worth the self assessed 4 stars or the money they charge. Cleaning of the room was ber half hearted and cleaners left our door unlocked and open while we were out. Also if you do choose to use this hotel make sure that you get the quote in writing as they charged us almost $50 a night more than was quoted on the phone. When I complained and said I would write a poor review on Trip Advisor the reception staff were supremely indifferent. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great find for the price and location. Would stay Again. Family room”
Reviews.Author: SamSmithSurfs
Reviews.Content: Comfy beds. Pillows a bit hard. Breakfast included - continental in the fridge of the room - but adequate and convenient. Didn't have towels or breakfast for the 3rd person but brought them up straight away when we phoned them. From first phone call to book and at check in staff helpful and friendly. Thanks for a pleasant overnight stay

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Marigoldlady
Reviews.Content: Positives: We chose the Hyde Park Inn because of its excellent location -- across from Hyde Park, and within walking distance of the main sights. Hotels in Sydney are quite expensive, so price was a consideration as well. (We paid $209 for each of 3 nights.) Parking is available (underground) and free. There is also a free laundry available to guests. The young lady at the front desk was very courteous and helpful. The room is quite large and has a nice view of the park. It has a kitchenette and a very light breakfast (cereal, bread) is left in the fridge every day. Negatives: The noise was terrible. We booked one of the deluxe studio rooms which were supposed to be quieter but we must have been on the lowest deluxe floor. Even with the windows closed we could hear constant traffic and conversation on the street below. It felt like we were on the first floor with the window open! This went on all night. We discovered in the middle of the last night that the air conditioner didn't work. We hadn't needed it earlier. The room itself was fairly clean but the bedspread was stained. The kitchen did not receive a thorough cleaning each day. (We washed our own dishes and put things away.)

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and not good for families”
Reviews.Author: melloCanberra
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a fantastic location and the views were awesome which is what you expect when you pay so much money. But I wouldn't stay here again. The hotel reception staff were not friendly. The walls were thin and even though the management left a note alerting travelers that renovations were under way within the hotel they said the noise would begin at 9am and finish by 6pm each evening. This was false. The banging and drilling started at 6am and finished late at night. I didn't have a good nights sleep for 4 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great value.”
Reviews.Author: Bartforde
Reviews.Content: As we all know Sydney accommodation is not cheap. This hotel was really close to all the attractions we needed to see at a really good price. No in house dining was not a problem as we were close to a great assortment of food restaurants. Close to Circular Quay, bus routes only 30 mins from the Airport out of peak times. Strongly recommend this Hotel if you don't want to pay to much for your accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Australiafrancophile
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights and chose the hotel for 2 reasons. The location is Elizabeth St ,across the road from Hyde park and Museum station,only 15 mins by train from the airport.It is about 10-15 mins walk to Circular Quay or one train station.It is not far to walk to Central station (one station) or Chinatown. The free city loop bus 555 goes past and is great but has limited hours. I also wanted a studio rather than a hotel room.There was one single bed and one double bed,a sofa and chair,small dining table and a kitchen bench with microwave.It was a very comfortable room but the only negative was very uncomfortable (hard and irregular) beds which need replacing.If the beds were comfortable I would have given 5 stars.Parts of the hotel are being refurbished so maybe they will get new beds.They provide basic provisionsfor a light breakfast that can be supllemented from the large Woolworths supermarket nearby.

Reviews.Title: “We would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: MissKDonkey
Reviews.Content: We have been here 3 nights of a 4 night stay. I was a little apprehensive about it because of some of the mixed reviews, here is what I found: we come to Sydney pretty regularly and a lot of the accommodation is really expensive .Hyde Park Inn is a mid range family hotel in an excellent central location, just opposite Hyde Park. Easy walking distance to most things, lots of restaurants and cafes nearby. The hotel is being updated and there is still some renovation going on but we didn't find this an issue. We stayed in room 803 on the 8th floor. There was some traffic noise, but there is double glazing. We have what they call a deluxe room with, a queen size bed and a single. There are two lounge chairs, small table, with three chairs, a flat screen tv and small but adequate bathroom. There is breakfast left each day in the fridge, sort of an Aussie continental breakfast of cereal, toast, juice with tea and coffee facility. This is a good value place to stay. There is parking available on site. The staff is a little impersonal but okay. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Solid Hotel, needs a little TLC to make 4 Stars”
Reviews.Author: JPH66
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night only on a special of $192 a night for a large studio room, on the 4Th floor, which was a lot larger than most deluxe hotel suites - the bathroom was new with a very good shower and no fogged up mirrors! The compact kitchenette had everything you could need and the included breakfast products were of good quality and enough for two adults. The room had 2 double beds, TV, VCR -, lounge area with couches and coffee table, very spacious!Even though the location is on a busy road, we heard nothing all night once the windows are closed - the air conditioning was brilliant ( it was a hot and humid night), being absolutely quiet while we slept.We heard no noise from other rooms or the hallway despite our floor being quite full. Check-in and out was quick, simple and efficient. Our only issue was the cleanliness of the bedspreads having really obvious stains on it (photos included), and there being hairs ( not ours) in the bathroom from the previous guests - these were easily spotted and were a disappointing sight.But we would stay again. The hotel isn't 5 star and doesn't boast it, but I would give them a solid 4. if they attend to the little cleanliness issues, they would be a solid 4.5.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: cheznuts
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights. On business in Sydney and needed basic cooking facilities. We booked a double and were allocated a large room (one queen, 2 singles and a divan). Room was clean and the bathroom had recently been refurbished so was lovely and new. New carpets too. There was a small balcony overlooking Hyde Park but when the door was open it was fairly noisy but very good double glazed windows and door resulted in very low noise inside room when closed. There was some work going on refurbishing rooms in the floor above us but we were warned about possible extra noise at the time of making the booking. It didn't bother us at all. Great value as the room included a basic breakfast (juice, bread for toast, cereal and milk, fruit) as well as car parking (although the carpark was very tight). Location is good too. Reception staff seemed nice although apart my checking in and out we didn't have any contact with them. Not five star but it's clean, well positioned and quiet. Very good value for money. We'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great allrounder”
Reviews.Author: Ethel2
Reviews.Content: This hotel had everything you could want for central Sydney. The location is great with lovely views across Hyde Park and a short stroll to the main shops along the way to the harbour. It is good value as the kitchenettes provide everything you need to eat in the rooms and save on costly meals out. Some people have moaned about the breakfast but if you already know what to expect what is there to complain about? Each day the room is re-stocked with biscuits, cereals, milk, fruit juice, and fruit. You also receive a complimentary newspaper. There is a launderette with plenty of washing machines and dryers in the basement and ironing boards and irons in the rooms which is great if you are travelling around as we were.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value”
Reviews.Author: sbrown-jakarta
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here twice now, and will return. The Hyde Park Inn is good value - in fact it is excellent value considering its central location. I liked being on the park, and on the free bus line. The free parking was good, as we had a hire car, but the free bus was also a bonus when we wanted to head to Chinatown or Circular Quay. Cooking facilities in the rooms were adequate, and the free clothes washing facilities were also useful. The only major criticism was the lack of free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for families in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Hop3fullyL0st
Reviews.Content: We (2A - 2C) stayed here just after Australia Day in 2012, in one of the Deluxe Family Rooms. We chose the Hyde Park Inn (HPI) mainly for the price and the fact it included parking. As an ex-Sydney family, the idea of being right on Hyde Park for the weekend was the icing on the cake. We were in one of the rooms which has already had the bathroom refurbishments done, and it has been completed to a very high standard. We didn't notice the noise from within the hotel, and only minimal noise from outside, so the assumption is the reno's are working well. The room had a queen bed and two singles, as well as a standard size round dining table and a nice little kitchenette - don't try to cook a banquet, but perfect for breakfast and preparing food for the day ahead. The included breakfast materials (4 different cereal packets, 4 little fruit tubs, 4 bits of bread, 4 * 600ml milks and assorted spreads) actually managed to make almost everyone happy. Everything else we needed was quickly grabbed from the Coles supermarket in World Square (about 200-300 m) The local area is great for those visiting Sydney and not wanting the car. We walked to Luna Park, via the Rocks and Harbour bridge and returned via the Ferry to Darling Harbour and walked back from there. There are two supermarkets and a wide variety of shops, cafe's, restaurants and entertainments in the immediate area. There are a number of excellent coffee shops, and I would recommend a morning flat white from the cafe behind the entrance to Museum Station across the road in Hyde Park. The area is safe for travelers who take normal city style precautions, and we enjoyed our return to the hotel by foot from various spots around the city late each evening. One of the best for families we have found.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: DeltaDawn2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located across from Hyde Park in downtown Sydney. It is close to shopping and the business area, a taxi ride to cruise port. Located close to hop-on hop-off bus stop. The staff is helpful and accommodating. We were there during a busy time before Christmas and the staff remained good natured, trying to meet a variety of requests. The hotel does not have a restaurant and breakfast is placed in the room, which has a kitchen bar. Rooms are spacious and comfortable. Value for families on a budget since small meals can be prepared in the room. Am not aware of a nearby grocery store, however. This was ideal overnight before embarking cruise ship. Hotels closer to port are more expensive. My husband lost his wallet in a restroom in the hotel and when we called the hotel they contacted me by email to let us know it was found. They arranged to return it by registered mail at our cost. Their follow up was efficient and quick. Hotel is secure and quite quiet. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great view”
Reviews.Author: FayFargo
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, utility apartment, new bathroom and a balcony with a view of downtown Sydney. Each morning we enjoyed the supplies provided by the hotel along with the meat pies from the local bakeries. It was a great introduction to Sydney. Got up each morning and walked in the park and watched the people of this busy city.

Reviews.Title: “Best value-for-money in Sydney.”
Reviews.Author: Aldaron8
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the HPI and were thoroughly impressed. The room was spacios and clean, the beds about the most comfortable I've slept on, and the staff helpful, competent and friendly. The location is fantastic, and we really appreciated little touches like secure parking, and the complementary breakfast & newspaper. It's definitely saved in my "favourites"!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and spacious room”
Reviews.Author: 7AndyWang7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night. We loved the location of this hotel. Cross the street was the Hyde Park, within walking distance to darling harbor (about 20 minutes), to Sydney Opera House and Circular Quay (about half an hour). Since we have a car, and it was very convenient for us that this hotel could provide a parking spot. Parking in Sydney was NOT easy. Simple breakfast was also included.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy”
Reviews.Author: jacqui j
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at Hyde Park Inn was great. Only 2 small criticisms: be the size of the parking spaces, very small. (we have a Holden Astra, I couldn't imagine parking one of those large 4 x 4). However, if you don't mind a bit of manoeuvring, hey free parking. The second criticism would be the sun coming through the curtains, but for early risers that wouldn't be a problem. The Hotel a little old fashioned but clean, central and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Terri D
Reviews.Content: I've stayed three previous times to this past visit...hence the fourth stay. I had a room on the top floor and had a great view out over Hyde Park and toward the Wooloomooloo park of the Harbour. I love the room size, just right for spreading out while on vacation. The kitchenette is fully stocked with everything to make light meals on the stove top and in the microwave. The service is always wonderful and friendly and I appreciate the small details. My bags were in my room when I returned to the hotel (after leaving them in baggage hold because of an early morning arrival). The walk to the Circular Quay area isn't too bad, about 15 minutes so location is good. You are right in the CBD area so shops and restaurants are nearby. I definitely became a fan from the good service and am planning my stay for next year.

Reviews.Title: “Top Location”
Reviews.Author: Ted M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed in this Hotel quite a few times over several years whenever we are travelling from Sydney. It is located in one of the most central parts of the city within easy walking distance of the Art Galley, major Department Stores and opposite Hyde Park. The units are of ample size and most if not all have a kitchenette and a Continental Breakfast is provided in the unit. Without doubt we will continue to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: TobyGhose
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with my parents. Excellent Location right in front of the Hyde Park Anzac Memorial. All the local attractions are close by, walking distance to Sydney Tower. Room was big enough. Had requested for a smoking room - which we got (very hard to find them these days). B/F is nothing grand, but then it serves the purpose. Our room had a small kitchen with all the amenities to cook your meal. The hotel has recently undergone renovations earlier this year. View from the room was just awesome (we were on the 12th floor). Staff were very friendly, and were able to help us with everything. Underground car park available on site.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: willow283
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had to travel to Sydney for business. We stayed one night at the Hyde Park Inn in a Superior room. The rooms are quite spacious with a queen bed and a single bed. There is a kitchenette with a fridge, microwave and electric stove. The room was very clean and tidy. We had a view over Hyde Park. Traffic noise was noticable but not disturbing. We were on the 8th floor. The staff were very helpful and friendly and the car park is definetly not made for large cars. At present they have refurbishment works taking place. We were warned about this before we booked but we did not have any problems with this work taking place. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: Karynw71
Reviews.Content: i found it pricey for a family of four but the location and the room size etc made up for it. Oh and the car park is not made for bigger cars such as four wheel drives !

Reviews.Title: “great family hotel”
Reviews.Author: grevo
Reviews.Content: Really great hotel. we had a family gathering and had the 2 family deluxe suites - one at each end of a corridor. Rooms very clean, serviced every day and clean bathroom. I had read reviews about the noise but we were only on the 5th floor and it wasn't a problem unless you had the balcony door open - very soundproof at night. It is in the middle of the city people! Great location, great views and the 4 kids played football in the park across the road (accompanied!). Close to all transport - including the mono rail. Aust Museum just across the park. restaurants/cafes nearby or you can order in. breakfast lovely - again we had seen a few neg comments but was fine - not huge - but fine. The only complaint was the hideously tight carpark - very, very hard to negotiate! I wouldn't recommend the suites if the parents want some private time - totally open plan! The staff were very helpful and arranged a late checkout for us. I recommend this hotel and would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: aqavenue
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with my friends after a conference. The hotel is conveniently situated close to the metro station, restaurants, cafes, Chinatown, QVB, Hyde Park, coach stop for tours etc. All are within walking distance. We could walk back safely from restaurants or Chinatown after dinner without need to go through small streets. We booked 3 rooms, one for 3 persons, one for 2 and one single room. The rooms were slightly outdated and the lights were a bit too dim. Kitchen facilities were available and we could prepare our own breakfast, which was actually very good for us. Rooms were quiet despite close to various spots mentioned above. Staff were generally helpful. Most importantly, the price was very reasonable and we all think it worths all the $$ that we paid. I would recommend this hotel given the very reasonable price and quality.

Reviews.Title: “HYDE PARK INN, SYDNEY - GREAT FAMILY HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: kate66
Reviews.Content: We stayed there last year during our trip to Sydney and Melbourne. What attracted us the most was the room came with 2 queen beds and a daybed. So, it was perfect for family of 5. Very central in Sydney and they have a convenience store downstairs. Absolutely great for those with family (like us) or friends wishing to stay in the same room and save money. Taking up 2 rooms is costly in a city of Sydney, so this was perfect for us. We bought food and got them heated up in the microwave and there was a small dining table, and kichenette, so it's really very convenient for those travelling on a budget. Breakfast was juices, milk and break and fruits in the mini fridge, which was more than enough for the 5 of us. So for the price paid, we are very happy. Plus they are just infront of of the train station exit. We arrived Sydney late at night and took a train conveniently to Hyde Park. Toilet was very clean with good showers. We are happy to have found this gem.

Reviews.Title: “good central location for a family of 4”
Reviews.Author: unsamunsa5
Reviews.Content: It is very difficult to get good affordable accomadation for a family of 4 in Sydney. We ended up getting a family room for about $220 pn on wotif, great deal. There is free parking on site (do not go in if you have a slightly largish car as it is very, very tight) as well as off site free parking a block away. The Museum rail station is across the road or it is only a 20 minute walk down to circular quay. The monorail is also only a couple of blocks away. The rooms appear to have been recently refurbished. There was plenty of room, with a queen bed and two singles. Also has a kitchenette with microwave and some lounge chairs. The views are lovely across to Hyde park. Bathroom in the room we stayed was brand new, very much to my liking. The only two issues I had were with the breakfast, light continental (ie corn flakes and toast) supplied in the room. the option of a cooked breakfast would have been nice. And the sound proofing between floors is non exsistent. I think the people above us had kids than ran free (or possibly an exercise class was happening because that is what it sounded like. Luckily they finished doing whatever they where doing before midnight... If we need to go to Sydney again, we would have no hesitation staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: PracticalVacationer
Reviews.Content: I rated "very good" for Hyde Park Inn because of the following: 1) Great location. Restaurants, cafes, public transportation, chinatown, QVB, park, etc. everything you'd want is within short walking distance. And yet, surprsingly, it was not as loud or as busy as some of the other main streets. 2) Family friendly. When I was doing my research on hotels I found that most of the hotels in Sydney only allow two people to a room. Some allow three. There were only a handful which allowed a family of four or five to be in one decent size room. Hyde Park Inn also had what I really needed in terms of bed configuration - a double (or queen, I can't recall) for my husband and I and a single for each of the kids. 3) Breakfast and kitchen supplies. We liked having breakfast supplied in our own kitchen so we can have it whenever we choose to. It was simple but adequate. The microwave was great because when the kids were too tired to go out, we brought food back to them and they could warm it up. 4) Staff. Helpful and friendly. And now for the not so great points: 1) Bedding linen. Old and shabby coverlet, not very clean looking. Extra sheet over blankets would be nice. 2) Bathroom. Shower stall should be renovated. No proper shampoo, just a kind of liquid soap for body and hair. 3) Hot water. It runs out if you are in the family rooms because each unit comes with its own hot water heater. By the time the 4th person takes a shower, it will be cold.

Reviews.Title: “Not Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: cudgee
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews and we were not disappointed. We had the deluxe suite on the tenth floor overlooking the park. The kitchen had a nice view overlooking the park and there was a small balcony (good for watching the fruit bats at night). We had no problems with noise except for a few sirens at night. Breakfast was enough for us- toast, juice, cereal and fruit cup. A newspaper as well. We were in walking distance of Darling Harbour as well as the Opera house. There was also one of those free 555 buses that passes by but we did not use it..My only complaint is that I had a bit of a problem getting the right temperature in the shower. I would highly reocommend it and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A great place for families to stay, we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Joemdee
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night with 3 of my children, to attend a performance at the opera house. The room was a great size, and immaculate, with everything we needed, plus an amazing view!! The breakfast provided was a great touch, as I was on my own with the kids it made our stay so much easier, and the servings were definitely adequate. The location was great, and made it so easy to get to circular quay, and I didn't find the noise to be that disturbing. We were in floor 14, but I had the balcony door open about a quarter, and all 3 kids slept soundly. I loved that there was a DVD player too, as the place we stayed last year did not provide one.

Reviews.Title: “Very Central and a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MarieAnnNZ
Reviews.Content: We booked Hyde Park Inn over the internet and were happy with our choice. Reception staff were very welcoming and helpful. It was pretty central to everything we wanted to do and see. The rooms were spacious - the kitchen was not that well equiped but adequate. Breakfast was very good and delivered to the fridge daily. Housekeeping not that good, towels not changed even when left in the bathtub, but that said really nothing to complain about. We were happy with our choice, and if had another holiday in Sydney would return.

Reviews.Title: “Tired &smelly with discourteous manager”
Reviews.Author: Richd57
Reviews.Content: Self-rated as 4 star but 3 star at most. 2nd floor room was tired, noisey from road traffic & the whole floor smelt of stale smoke. We asked for a non-smoking room but were given a smoking room and the manager became cross when we would not stay in it. They would not provide any alternative so we lost our money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but limited facilities”
Reviews.Author: newkstar
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed several times at the Hyde Park Inn for work and found it very satisfactory. Although it claims 4 stars, the lack of facilities means it is a good 3 star premises. I have used it for longer stays, when there is a real advantage in having a kitchenette for self-catering. The location is excellent for getting to most places in the CBD and it has the added benefit of being directly opposite the Museum Station in Hyde Park, This is a station for the train to the airport. Although the train is an outrageous $15 a ticket, and it has no facilities for luggage, it is still the best way to ad from the airport, especially during peak hour traffic. Try to get a room as high as possible in the hotel. This will help reduce the street noise - which is a factor here - and you will get a good view over Hyde Park and what a real estate agent would describe as "harbor glimpses". They have been doing refurbishments for a while now but I have not found that they create any inconvenience. The rooms do need an upgrade. The bathrooms are small but adequate, although no bath. There is internet but it is slow. There are no in-house dining facilities. The price does include bread, yoghurt and juice for breakfast. Overall, I would recommend this for anyone who values self-catering. Both the location and price are excellent. If you are looking for 4 start hotel facilities (and perhaps peace and quiet) then I'd look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “We keep coming back!”
Reviews.Author: Cattai
Reviews.Content: Just excellent! Opposite Hyde Park, wonderful staff, fantastic rooms...they've thought of everything...plenty of lights, mirrors, beautiful bathrooms, white fluffy towels, comfortable beds, kitchenettes, glassware and crockery in tip top condition, table and chairs you can actually sit at to eat and lounges to relax on. We've been to many hotels, but keep coming back to "Hyde Park Inn" in Sydney again and again. Oh, they even have a complimentary light breakfast included in the tariff and free secure parking. Public transport isn't a problem either with bus stops to all parts of Sydney only a minute's walk from the door.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: TheGirls17
Reviews.Content: Just up from melbourne for Mardi Gra , so needed a 2 bedroom apartment. Was nice to have a balcony but so noisy when the balcony door was open. The place is ok but needs a refurb thats for sure. The bathroom is tired and a bit yuck The hallways were a little smell and the carpets need a good clean . It was handy to be close to everything and have a big space but you do pay for that. The staff where nice and pleasant. The parking was a nightmare , the spots are too small to get in and out easily and took allot of effort to not hit other cars ..

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, dirty and noisy”
Reviews.Author: TessYng11
Reviews.Content: A dirty hotel which is way over-priced. It is more a motel than a hotel. The carpets are dirty, the continental breakfast is a joke and there is hammering & drilling from 9-5 every day. Very poor value. Some of the staff were helpful but I think management need to focus on improving the hotel. It is is a good location but for the price you can do a lot better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and great rooms”
Reviews.Author: trevar
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyde Park Inn on a business trip and found it to be one of the best. I was greeted by great staff, found the room very comfortable and spacious, and was especially impressed that the place wasn't very noisy, despite being in the centre of the most raucous city in the country. The room had something like a kitchenette, but without a hotplate, which I found odd. It was otherwise well-equipped, but of course without a hotplate there's not much you can cook. Breakfast was very much a no-nonsense affair. The hotel provided milk, cereal, bread, orange juice and packaged fruit (awful stuff, but the rest was nice). Being able to prepare a very simple breakfast in my room saved me a lot of time and fuss, so I loved this arrangement. The television, while a little on the small side, came with a few pay TV channels, and I was especially grateful for the movies. My reservation, which was made by my company, had been cancelled, which was no fault of the hotel's, but staff were more than accommodating and extremely helpful about getting the mix-up sorted out. I was very impressed with their professionalism. Overall, I was really impressed with my stay in this hotel, and would be happy to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic spot at a good price”
Reviews.Author: Yurugaboy
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a few times before.Our family of five fits easily in one room and the kitchenette allows us to cook or get takewaay and bring it back to the room.Kids go and play in the park oposite. Its a 2 minute walk to the Museum underground ticket machine.Around the corner is Chinatown or the great Korean BBQ places. very cheap but filling meals. The only small issue is the carparking.You need a smaller car and not be worried about handing over the keys.Forget the car and use public transport during your stay.We got continental breakfast, a carpark and a newspaper free in the deal.Past visits do count.Renos are happening at the moment,we were warned but heard nothing during our time there..We have stayed on various floors in similar rooms.All have been quiet and clean.Lifts need room passes to work but the staff are attentive and watch the front entrance against walkins.Great spot,great value.We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but traffic noise a major problem”
Reviews.Author: Ian_Pratt
Reviews.Content: Hyde Park Inn provides a good low cost base in the middle of Sydney. The hotel is located immediately opposite Hyde Park, and is about 2 minutes walk from Museum Station. Service was great - I showed up at 9.30am to leave my bags and was checked straight into my room. Impressive. Rooms are reasonably sized and freshly renovated. There's nothing fancy, but it's decent accommodation at a decent price. Breakfast is included in the room fee, and you get some bread and cereal to prepare in your room. Not a bad way of doing it at all. There were two jarring points for me. The first was the $22 a day internet charge, which in this day and age seem increasingly greedy. The second was the traffic noise. Located directly above Elizabeth St and with inadequate noise insulation, sleep was almost impossible. This is absolutely not a hotel for anyone but the deepes sleepers. It's a shame, because it is otherwise a decent choice, but the traffic noise is really, really over the top

Reviews.Title: “One word: Excellent”
Reviews.Author: CanuckCouple2
Reviews.Content: An excellent apartment hotel in the CBD opposite the attractive Hyde Park. Close to many restaurants, attractions. Excellent public transit, including free CBD bus route. The room was very spacious, a king bed and a double for a third person. Very reasonable charge for thirds. Very attractive, modern furnishings. Contintental breakfast delivered to room night before. Breakfast dishes washed by the housekeeper! Very clean and very comfortable. One negative: $11/hr internet use. This is unusually high. We used free WiFi in the city in stead.

Reviews.Title: “Good apartment choice in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: kerwei
Reviews.Content: Two words - great value. Rooms are spacious , clean and well maintained. Furniture functional. Staff are friendly. Onsite free parking is a real bonus. Do note that if the basement parking is full, you'll need to drive to a parking station about a block away. Good and very convenient location. It sits in between Chinatown and Circular Quay (about 15-20 minutes walk away). If you are taking the train from the airport, you can stop at the Museum Station and it's right there.

Reviews.Title: “great for a city location”
Reviews.Author: celineArizona
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in a very large room with 3 beds and a kitchenette. Breakfast is placed in your fridge in the afternoon for the following morning. This was quite adequate and saved us a bundle of money. The beds were comfortable and the hotel was conveniently located in Sydney. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located hotel right in Sydney CBD”
Reviews.Author: aukahkay
Reviews.Content: Located directly opposite Museum Station, Hyde Park Inn is an excellent hotel for both business and leisure. The room that I had was a studio with a double bed and a single bed and kitchenette. Continental breakfast is stocked daily in the refrigerator.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: oxymoron2010
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel in the downtown of the city is great. The access to public transportation, closeness to gardens etc. make this hotel ideal for a vacation. The welcome at the hotel was very comforting.The check - in at the hotel was smooth and quick. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was modern with all the modern amenities. I would surely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: elainejane
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hyde Park Inn & after reading some negative reviews we were pleasantly surprised to find the room very clean & generous in size. The kitchenette was a bonus & adequate breakfast provisions were replenished each day. Unfortunately the room was very noisey at night. However as the hotel is currently undergoing extensive refurbishment the noise level should be reduced when double glazing is completed. Another criticism I would have is that they only provide liquid soap and do not provide any shampoo/conditioner. There is a liquid soap dispenser next to the handbasin in the bathroom & another in the shower. I did not find this to be 'user friendly' and would much prefer to have 'real' soap. We had our own shampoo & conditioner so it did not effect us but guests who rely on this being provided would be inconvenienced. I understand the liquid soap is also suitable for hair washing but I personally would not like to use it. Staff were very pleasant & most helpful during our stay. Location is good with easy access to Museum Railway station and buses stop just along from the front door. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location opposite musuem stop, handy for the airport.”
Reviews.Author: password023
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four night. Good sized room, it was nice to have small kitchen area to make drinks, and store items in fridge. Enjoyed having lounge area to watch TV etc, better than having to lay on your bed. All in all, had a great time in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice for Sydney stay.”
Reviews.Author: pomsontour
Reviews.Content: We booked into the Hyde Park Inn over Christmas and New Year. Given the rates charged by hotels in Sydney over this period the HPI was reasonably priced. Our only issue was that our room was a little dirty upon arrival. However we reported this to the reception who came and cleaned the room straight away. The room it'self was large with full kitchen, loads of storage and very comfortable. The HPI provide an in room breakfast that is left in your fridge the day before. This proved more than adequate and saved going out and spending more money. The HPI is in a great location - could walk to everything including the ferries at Circular Quay. Some reviews said that there was a lot of street noise - certainly there is some, it's a large city centre after all. However we did not find it a problem. Overall a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: craftysurfer
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights in this hotel, very good value and good location. Breakfast provided in your room, this saved going out and finding somewhere to eat in the morning. The hotel is on Elizabeth street and the free bus 555 runs past it down to circular quay. Very noisy outside the hotel and lots of shops and cheap eating places nearby. Our room wasn't made up on 2 days, luckily we weren't messy people so tidied our own room up ! If you stay here make sure you look out of the window at dusk to see the bats flying past

Reviews.Title: “awfully dirty for the price”
Reviews.Author: domtom98845
Reviews.Content: When we arrive there was hair on the cover of the bed.... The fridge contained food of another customer. The floor of the kitchen stuck. The internet tariff was so expensive (11$ one hour, 22$ a day), that we can think that Australia was an under developped country.

Reviews.Title: “mind the bloodspots on the quilt cover-reception doesnt care”
Reviews.Author: giro_mondo_86
Reviews.Content: Extremely rude and impersonal front desk attendants, and the hotel manager is just as arrogant, if not worse- Definitely do not recommend the hyde park inn if you are planning a seamless hotel stay, 3 different rooms in 3 nights, with no apology, and not to mention the blood spots on the quilt cover in the third room. The closest I got to a smile or even a civil conversation at this place was with the hotel's bell boy who assisted in moving our luggage from one room to the next on both days. I am a Sydney resident and quite honestly I'm disgusted and embarrassed with the service I received at Hyde Park Inn. If you are a visitor to Sydney I recommend looking at other accomodation as to stay here and receive the same level of service that I received would leave you thinking that my wonderful city is nothing but trash!

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Sydney; very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: john_mette
Reviews.Content: We were a little unsure about staying at this hotel as we'd read some mixed reviews, but its location and good price was the determining factor. We found the staff to be extremely helpful, and nothing was too much trouble for them. Having heard that we'd been ripped off by the taxi driver who drove us to the hotel from Sydney Airport - they arranged for a taxi driver they knew to take us to the airport at the conclusion of our stay. Our room was spacious and clean and had a good view over Hyde Park. The hotel is ideally located for the harbour and opera house, and some excellent Asian restaurants can be found just behind the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Pardo
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in the Hyde Park Inn. I'd echo most of what I've read here for the Hyde Park Inn. Fantastic location at Museum station, with rooms overlooking the ANZAC monument in the park. Prices realtively reasonable for Sydney, but expensive nevertheless by other city's standards. Everything functioned properly in our room. Smallish bathroom (shower not bath), but adequate. Continental breakfast placed in the fridge the day before, suited us fine (juice, fruit salad, cereal, toast, etc). Sure, some city noise but what do you expect in a vibrant, cosmopolitan and young metro area. Upgrading work going on when we were there at the end of March, but no noise or other disturbance to us. Ridiculous price for internet like elsewhere, so didn't bother on principle. Used my laptop off site or one of the internet cafes round the corner on Liverpool St. We love Sydney, and would stay here again on our next visit. Watching the nightly spectacle of the flying foxes buzzing the square, from the tiny balcony, is a memory that will stay with us.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location, a bit noisy though”
Reviews.Author: boxmoxley
Reviews.Content: The location is wonderful with the museum train stop right across the street. There is a monorail stop fairly close by at the World Square. Our two-bedroom unit overlooked the ANZAC memorial in Hyde Park. It was a bit noisy and hopefully the renovation will include thicker windows. Given the location in Sydney, the price was great for us. The front desk were friendly although a bit weird about using their "business center" computers for internet access. The laundry was located on the ground floor, but not easy to find. It was an enjoyable stay here and I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Lea-Anne M
Reviews.Content: Hyde Park is lovely, we were close to the shops and to the theatre what more could you want. The staff were great and very helpful, check in was easy, staff offered to carry up our bags and we got a newspaper to our room daily..which is nice. The room was a good size and very clean. We had a continental breakfast in our room which was great start to the day. My only complaint is the parking down stairs is very small, but if you ask the staff they are more than happy to help park your car.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Scotsinsydney
Reviews.Content: Hyde Park Inn is a great place to stay, as it is so close to everything that Sydney has to offer, We were on the 7th floor and had lovely views from our Balcony over Hyde Park and beyond. Check in was handled well by the 2 male staff on duty, who were pleasant and helpful. Unfortunately, we didn't receive quite such nice service from the female staff on checking out. We didn't get asked if we had enjoyed our stay, or if everything was ok. Looking forward to seeing bathroom refurb next time we visit as they are badly lacking in shelving of any sort to put toiletries on.

Reviews.Title: “Wait for the renovation to be finished”
Reviews.Author: Stefan_Boer
Reviews.Content: I don't understand the good reviews, unless the other reviewers have already stayed at a renovated room. There is a renovation program in progress (through mid 2012) that is sorely needed. The rooms are large but drab and the soundproofing is really bad -- the very busy traffic on Elizabeth street is very loud in the room even though we stayed on a high floor. The beds are quite old and not very comfortable. There is no WiFi at all and wired internet did not work and had to be purchased -- for this rate I would expect complimentary WiFi. Also it is not possible to book a non-smoking room! We got a smoking room even though we had requested non smoking three months in advance. There was only a slight smell of smoke, but still. There is also no safe deposit box in the room. The location by Hyde Park is great, and we liked the complimentary do-it-yourself continental breakfast that it delivered to the fridge in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: JARFeb11
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for a week with my hisband and 10 year old son and would highly recmmend it.! There is a free shuttle bus stop just up the street that takes you around to all the major attractions but does not run at nights (except thursdays to 7pm). We had a standard studio room on the 3rd floor which is nice and roomy, with not only the queen bed and single but also room for loinge chairs, a small kitchenette and a table, Contrary to previous reports of road noise due to Elizabth street being a busy street, the double glazed windows more than effectively cut out any traffic noise. The hotel had also advised me that renovations were occurring and that there may be noise during the day from about 9.30am till 4pm daily. (mon-fri).. However as we were generally out during these hours we did not encounter any inconvenience or excessive noise. The continental style breakfast that gets left in the fridge is a convenient start to the day,

Reviews.Title: “Paying for great location, not a beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: Cangirl_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in a two bedroom apartment. Location excellent - lots of great restaurants nearby, park and train station across the street (note there is no lift at the station and a lot of stairs - if you are 2 people, it's only $20 more to take a taxi vs train to the airport). Lobby is modern however rooms look outdated in particular the bathroom. Rooms, bathroom, and kitchen were all very bland looking with the furniture, lighting, and decorations. Bed was comfortable, shower low pressure. Second bedroom's AC started making a very loud noise just before bed and had to be turned off. Satellite wasn't coming in properly on TV in living room. Nice to get continental breakfast in fridge for the following morning - breads with butter/jam, cereals, fruit cups, and OJ/milks. Reception staff were very friendly and helpful. It's a comfortable place to stay in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, excellent amenities and location.”
Reviews.Author: FeistyKel
Reviews.Content: 3 of us stayed in a family room for a girls weekend away. The room was clean and well equipped. It's close to George street so pretty central, right opposite Hyde park and museum station. Great balcony views. We had a great time and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice finding”
Reviews.Author: mrebello
Reviews.Content: Me and my family wanted to spend New Year's Eve in Sydney, but we had only one month in advance to book a hotel. After a lot of research, and finding out that most of the places in Sydney were already booked out, I call Hyde Park Inn and to my surprise they still had a studio apartment available. Being NYE, the prices were more expensive than usual, but I was just happy to have found a good place to stay and enjoy NYE with my family in Sydney. With respect to the quality of the hotel, we were very satisfied. From the beginning the staff was very friendly and helpful. The studio apartment had everything we needed (1 double bed, and 2 singles), TV and a small kitchen with a fridge. They also provide breakfast! They bring it to your room one day before. Breakfast consists of orange juice, diced peaches and pears, slices of bread, butter, peanut butter, jelly, milk, cereals, cookies, etc. It is very nice and tasty! The beds were comfortable and we could sleep well at night. It was a little bit noisy, since the hotel is on Elizabeth St, which is a major street in the Sydney city area. We were in the 6th floor, so we could hear the cars. But nothing uncomfortable. Nobody complained about it, and we could still sleep well. Housekeeping is reasonably good. But there was one day that the person servicing our room didn't put much effort to make our beds. But that was not a big deal. Overall, i would definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room and location”
Reviews.Author: Crystal_nz
Reviews.Content: Great room - one queen and one single bed. Cooking facilities and en suite. Reasonable rate. (We stayed here having extensively reviewed Trip Advisor). Only criticism is there isn't a communal area - lounge or bar or dining room - though there is an adjacent and adjoining restaurant - so no real chance of interacting with other guests. Also a wonderful pasta bar a few doors up the road - delicious ready made meals to be taken back to the room and heated in the microwave. There was a very small lounge, smaller than our bedroom, where we could rest having checked out. However it was perfect for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Yup it's loud, but no problem with the aircon on. Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: vailskiier22
Reviews.Content: Clean, fresh kitchen. Room furniture/kitchen looked almost brand new. Breakfast handy and just fine (OJ/fruit salad individual tubs, 2 slices bread each, individual cereal packets, good quality tea/coffee packets) - so you can go straight out without hunting down breakfast. Bathroom, clean fine. Road loud, but I like fresh air, so it's nice to be able to open the sliding door in the evening and enjoy the city hustle. No noise from other rooms - but maybe because aircon cancels it out too! Asked for and received high room - wow they respect email requests - that's a first! 14th floor, views to the entrance of the harbour, nearly, but not quite to opera house, ah well! Bed comfy. With air con on, the road noise was no problem (2 x light sleepers) - only occasional siren, not as bad as someone said. Used one ear plug first night, then did not bother. With air con off, hmm would have been not so good, so maybe a winter issue? Staff efficient, knowledgeable, friendly enough (not overly - more professional than effusive) but never rude. Surprised to be eye to eye with flying foxes out of the window! Buses to Bondi around corner, buses to Circular key very close. Take note of other poster's instructions for accessing the train station with luggage. 15 mins airport on train. NB: Free bus stops 3:30pm week days. If you want to be at circular quay 24x7 - it might be a bit far to walk. Shopping areas close, Darling harbour close, Korean, Japanese, Chinese areas close. Tip don;t go to Chinese restaurant frequented by non-Chinese - there really is a clue there.. Charged $3 pp for a single pot of Chinese tea WTF!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value and location!”
Reviews.Author: xiphoid76
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel - fantastic location at Hyde park with a beautiful view. Room was nice, loud street below, nice kitchen and comfortable beds. This is the best value in Sydney. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to all visitors to this great city!

Reviews.Title: “The quality of the room and quality of the service are not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: aussie38traveler
Reviews.Content: Stay somewhere else where the rooms and public spaces are nicer and the staff is less rude.

Reviews.Title: “Big room, drab decor”
Reviews.Author: youngandfiftyish
Reviews.Content: Visited many years ago and liked it. Excellent size of room and well equipped. Drab colours let it down a little. Great location 2 minutes from Museum station. Very helpful reception staff. 10 minutes walk to Darling harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Young Kids!”
Reviews.Author: Jonesteam
Reviews.Content: This place is terrific - has a small kitchenette and brings you breakfast food the day before. You can easily stay with young kids in the Deluxe room. We have a 3 year old and 1 year old, and with the baby cot and extra single bed (in addition to the queen size) did great! We bought cheese, fruit, pasta, and veggies and did our own lunches, snacks, and dinner for the kids. They give you bread, jam, honey, butter, fruit cups, milk, cereal, and orange juice every day for the next morning's breakfast, and we ended up making a LOT of grilled cheese sandwiches in the convenient little kitchenette. Our kids did not like to shower before, so we were worried that we did not have a tub, but they did great in the shower - playing in there for 20 minutes at a time! The only "hardship" was getting the kids to sleep and having some time for ourselves, but once they did fall asleep we could watch movies from Netflix with the internet cable connected to our laptop (though internet is $60/night). The laundry machines are free, bring your own soap ($1.10 AUD to buy here). Location is superb, right across from the park, and walkable to many things, including Cook and Philips Aquatic and Fitness Center where we took the kids one day for a fun swim outing. Have fun at Hyde Park Inn!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, shame about the service!”
Reviews.Author: Rachivo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 7 nights, from Christmas day to new years day. We got the train from sydney airport to museum station, it took 12 mins and cost around 15AUD per persob, museum station is directly opposite the hotel. The hotel is immaculate, modern and comfortable, Hyde park is across the road which gives some resbit from the hectic city. Breakfast on Hyde park cafe was delicious. The hotel rooms were serviced daily, the laundary was very handy (free, you judt have to get the powder from reception which is acouple of dollars), there was free parking. Wifi was expensive but you can get computer access in the business centre on the 1st floor for 5.50AUD for the day. The bus stop was right across the road, it took 15 mins to get to bondi on the 333 bus, you buy tickets im the train station for about 6AUD per person. Everything was within walking distance from the hotel, Darling and Sydney harbour was 15 mins, the shops are 5 mins. I highly recommened going to the visitors centre in the rocks area for information. This leads me to the downside of the hotel, reception. The staff were friendly but had little knowledge of the area (we arrived christmas day to be told the only food abailable was mcdonalds, we set out amd found numerous restaurants and cafes open, evem taragon zoo was open!) also on check in we were told to pay on departure, then we reveived a note asking us to pay, then when we went to pay we were told to pay on departure. The confusiom over payment happened numerous times, as did confusion over parking etc. Would definately stay again, would just not rely on reception for amything! We booked through booking.com and paid around Â£160 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location!”
Reviews.Author: PDXsunSearcher
Reviews.Content: Directly across from Hyde Park. Rail station averse across the street (no lift) but we rolled our bags with us to the main station within walking distance. Buses stop just in front of the hotel. But we ended up walking almost everywhere. I never found a laundry facility but maybe I didn't look enough since it was early in the trip. Incredibly quiet, but lack of free wifi was annoying, although this lack was common throughout Australia. There is a pasta takeout place a few doors down. We picked up dinner, moved the chairs to the balcony and had a great dinner one night. Although they provide some basic breakfast supplies, we found Cafe 255 a few doors down had free wifi and good food, reasonable prices and great service. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for family of four”
Reviews.Author: pepsi123
Reviews.Content: We stayed her 3rd-7th December this was our first hotel booked over our 4 week stay. Hotel was easy to find and clean. Rooms were large and had kitchen area. Breakfast was free and found each day in fridge. We were on the 3rd floor over looking the park. (couldn't see the park as there was huge trees in front of the window) The road outside the hotel is busy and you can hear noise from the traffic but it didn't keep us awake at all. Rooms were cleaned daily. There is a free landry you can use which was a great help. The only problem we had was on the day we left we needed to get a taxi to Darling habour to collect our hire car and the hotel said they couldn't book one as it was for only a short distance the reception guy went out and stopped one on the street they couldn't fit 4 people in and 3 suitcases. So after 15 minutes or so of stopping cabs and being told the same thing the reception guy just walked off and said nothing!!! My husband went in to ask what we should do but they were less than helpfull. Such a shame when we had such a good stay. After about 30 minutes a cab did stop and take us all my daugher had a suitcase on the floor under her legs!!! We would use this hotel again. But would of liked free internet or at least if paying for it a reasonable cost rather than it being so expensive to use.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: Mitchell-Family-01
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Hyde Park Inn from 10 December to 13 December 2010. I spent ages trying to look for a hotel in the Sydney CBD which not only catered for large families but was also friendly on the pocket. After an extensive internet search and with the help of Trip Advisor, we settled on the Hyde Park Inn. I have a family of 5 and we stayed in a Family Deluxe room on the 9th floor which consisted of a queen bed and 3 singles. Our balcony looked over looked the beautiful Hyde Park. The room contained a kitchenette, bathroom and all the usual mod cons. Just be aware though that all the beds are located in the one room so if you want your privacy, you would be better off booking a family suite. A continental breakfast is supplied in your room free of charge each day. The cost per night was great @ $242 for the 5 of us which was by far the cheapest I could find, especially for a 4 star hotel in the heart of Sydney. A few tips...... Transport: We flew in from Melbourne and caught the train from the Airport to Museum Station which is located across the road from the Hotel....This was expensive! It costs $20 per adult & $10 per child, a total of $70 for my family. We ended up booking a private maxi cab through the hotel on return to the Airport and it only cost us $50. Apart from the Airport train, I must say that Sydney has a great public transport system. Buses arrive/depart frequently every 3 -5 minutes. The bus stops are located on either side of the road and close to the Hotel. The 555 bus is free which takes you around the CBD to Sydney Harbour and the ferry service. The mono rail is within easy walking distance to the Hotel with the World Square stop only a 2 minute walk. Attractions: Darling Harbour is a comfortable 10 - 15 minute walk or you can go by mono rail. A good food court which is relatively cheap is located there. China Town is a 10 minute walk. Paddy's Market a 15 minute walk and you can also take the mono rail there. Sydney Harbour a 20 - 25 minute walk. I suggest a bus if you want to give walking a miss or catch the ferry from Darling Harbour. Shopping: Well you're pretty much right in the city centre. Try the World Square, Westfield Shopping Centre (which is a bit more upmarket that the Melbourne stores), plus the many malls. Overall, my family thoroughly enjoyed the Hyde Park Inn and the Sydney experience. We would return again to this Hotel because of the cost and great location. Thankyou.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Sydney central business district, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MarcMich
Reviews.Content: We were 3 nights at the Hyde park inn. Location is great, and city train station is within 50m. The kitchen in the room has all you need and complimentary breakfast is sufficient for starting your day. Next to the hotel there's a 7/11 shop which is open all day. Staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Everything a traveller needs including breakfast”
Reviews.Author: keithbcj
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a 2 night stopover en route from NZ to UK. Even on the 2nd floor, the good windows and efficient air conditioning meant that the traffic on Elizabeth Street was not a problem and location is excellent for buses and trains as well as having a nice outlook onto the park and being an easy walk to shopping, eating and attractions. The standard studio included a double and a single bed, cutlery and crockery for 3, fridge, convection/microwave cooker, toaster and kettle, armchair and settee, table and dining chairs and plenty of room for bags etc as well as ensuite shower room - overall very comfortable. A big plus is the provision of the makings of a continental breakfast in the fridge - cereals, milk, fruit salad, juice, bread,butter and spreads as well as the normal tea and coffee. We also welcomed the lack of high priced "mini bar" offerings - we resent the attempt in so many places to tempt or trick you into spending over the odds on stuff left in the room. Here, everything there was part of the deal. Great! Altogether a very satisfactory place to stay in Sydney if you are happy with comfort and convenience without pretention.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificently Helpful”
Reviews.Author: moeline
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it represents great value for this location for a family of five. What we didn't expect was that the staff would bend over backwards to be helpful at this price. When the wheelchair I had hired for the weekend didn't arrive, they found a chair for me, pumped up the tyres and let me borrow it for three days. They were polite, friendly and very efficient. We stayed in room 807, a family room, and found it to be comfortable and spotlessly clean. Far exceeded my expectations!

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL, CANT WAIT TO GO BACK”
Reviews.Author: newycrystal
Reviews.Content: I booked for my parents and I last minute to stay for one night whilst we were in Sydney for the Eagles concert. Had no idea what the hotel would be like as we normally stay at the large chain hotels. I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel is right across the road from Museum Station. Even though we were only 3 adults they put us in a family room that comprised a double bed and three single beds Also had a kitchenette with cereal, juice, tea, coffe and toast for the next morning. We were lucky enough to have a beautiful view of Hyde Park. As my parents were coming back to Sydney in the New Year with friends we enquired at the front desk about the different room type and the receptionist advised they have a room that can sleep up to 6 people. She even showed us a standard double room. I thought it would have been quiet small but I was very pleasantly surprised. I will definately return to this hotel and skip the usual chain hotels in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: emmadurban
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 nights at the Hyde park Inn in Sydney. We loved it here and would definately stay here again. The price for these serviced apartments was extremely reasonable and they have a small kitchenette with microwave and fridge etc. Iron and ironing boards are provided in the room, the room is large with very comfortable beds. Staff very accomodating and they even have a guest lounge which we used as we had a late flight in the evening. If you are staying here and coming from the airport, then get the train its alot easier. You basicaly have to get off at Museum station which takes about 15 mins, its about the 5th stop. When you walk out of the station at Museum then you will see the traffic lights, cross at the lights and turn right, you will hyde park inn sign just a few minutes walk. Very easy. Hotel was centrally located and you can walk to the harbour in about 10 mins. Cant fault the hotel was lovely and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best out there, but it definitely meets more than the necessary.”
Reviews.Author: thepearlyn
Reviews.Content: staff were pretty helpful, considering that it was not a 5star hotel - they helped us throughout our stay there. Everything was made easy even when we had to change rooms from a family room to a 2 bedroom apartment. The basic in-room breakfast every morning were adequate, they even have a dishwasher, and everything you need to cook a simple meal. The only turn off would be the carpets, which smelled a little - are probably pretty old. Overall stay at Hyde Park was more than pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable 1 1/2 weeks in a standard studio room!”
Reviews.Author: ValandHim
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a standard studio room on the 3rd floor for 1 Â½ weeks. Our room was large, comfortable & well set out â€“ especially the sofa & small chair with ottoman to rest our weary legs - and the excellent kitchenette. Floors 2 to 4 have double glazed windows, not balconies, so we had no trouble with loud traffic noise. We travelled by train from the airport to Museum Station just across the road from the hotel. Be warned that Museum Station has NO lifts or escalators. We found the first 2 flights of steps okay to manage our luggage. However the final flight up to street level is very steep â€“ so we recommend that, instead of exiting via the steps signmarked â€œTo Liverpool Stâ€�, go along the tunnel to the right marked â€œTo Castlereagh Stâ€�. Via a short tunnel, you reach a series of tunnels, take the right one marked â€œTo Liverpool St. Northâ€�. That exits at the very top of Liverpool St. (just around the corner from Elizabeth St.) via a short escalator. You donâ€™t need to go out into the open/weather or cross the busy intersection. Reception staff were always friendly & very helpful. On checkin, we enquired about our choices for breakfast cereals & bread and were able to get our preferences each day. H.P.I. has no breakfast restaurant, gym, pool, room service etc. but for those who donâ€™t require such services the hotel is a very comfortable well-located place to stay. There is a restaurant for lunch & dinner but we did not use that. Our standard studio room was large and very comfortable indeed! The kitchenette had everything we needed â€“ a large bar fridge & rollout drawer stored all the food items we bought. Storage space was excellent, wardrobe, bedside cabinets, as well as extra drawers in the desk. The hotel is well located, shops & supermarkets close by, as well as trains & buses. Itâ€™s a short walk to the main street, George Street. We did not use the free loop bus, which stops on Elizabeth St. near the hotel. However we recommend buying weekly MyMulti tickets, which entitle you to unlimited bus, train & ferry travel. Zone 1 tickets will take you to places such as Manly, Taronga Zoo, Parramatta, Watsons Bay, Bondi Beach etc. They are great value, costing $41 for adult & $20.50 for concession/pensioner. We used the free laundry, which has multiple machines â€“ only paid $1.10 for packet of washing powder per load. Besides the free laundry and breakfast a free paper is supplied each day too.

Reviews.Title: “Good service and quality but very noisy!”
Reviews.Author: CMW28
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in October 2010. The hotel is easy to find, provides an underground car park space if required, and will store luggage for customers if it is not check-in time. The room we had was on the 7th floor; it was a large room with a double and single bed, a small kitchenette and a dining table. I think most rooms have a balcony and these look out onto a road and then past that, Hyde Park. The room and bathroom were both clean and the kitchen had most basic requirements to make simple meals, or eat take-out in the room. A basic breakfast of a couple of pieces of bread and some cereal is provided each day to the room for the following day. Right outside the hotel there is a free 555 bus that you can get on that loops round the whole city very regularly - this was very useful. The only negative to the overall value of this hotel was the noise level. The hotel is right next to a very busy road, the traffic is very loud until about 2-3am with buses, taxis etc. It is quiet between 3-5am and then starts again with the daily commuters for work. The windows offer NO noise reduction at all, and we really struggled to sleep without ear plugs (which aren't provided). So overall a good value hotel if you are a deep sleeper, or have your own ear plugs!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and Convienient”
Reviews.Author: PQrev
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located opposite Hyde Park and around a 20 minute walk from the opera house. The rooms are huge and if your staying with family will more than satisfy. The breakfast is included but there is no breakfast room, instead you'll find your fridge is restocked every day with milk , juice, bread etc which saves a lot of time and effort in the morning. A good location and would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Lived there for almost 3 months!”
Reviews.Author: JSigler
Reviews.Content: My father had to work in Sydney and brought us along, so for 2 1/2 months my parents, brother, and I all stayed in one room at the Hyde Park Inn. Although there wasn't any personal space I liked the Hotel for it's view, convienence, and the kitchenette (which saved us loads by not having to eat out!) Its right on Hyde Park, and located close to the train station, and the free bus loop stop is right down the street. I had a lovely experience in Sydney, and I'm glad that the Hyde Park Inn was our home!

Reviews.Title: “happy days”
Reviews.Author: jamesthewedge
Reviews.Content: panaramic views of darling harbour and opera house also sydney bridge manley ferries veiws

Reviews.Title: “Fab location opposite free City Circular Bus Stop”
Reviews.Author: Maisymoopoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights on 5th floor overlooking Hyde Park. Very easy to get to from Airport via train, which stops across the road. Room had double and single bed, 2 seats and table and chairs with modern kitchenette and everything you might need, inc. wine opener!! Noise from road was expected from previous reviews but no trouble sleeping after sightseeing all day! To save a bit of money we often got takeaway from Pasta place on corner just a few shops away from Hotel; do fab moosaka, lasagne and salads which you can heat up in microwave in room. Continental breakfast sufficient for the two of us, cereal, toast and orange juice. Very clean and modern interior and would definitely stay there again as very easy to get to main attractions and the free City Circular Bus Stop is across road from hotel which loops around Circular Quay, Opera House, Central Train Station, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: Larry002
Reviews.Content: Great location for both circular quay (30min walk) and Darling Harbour(20min walk) if you did not want to walk a free shuttle bus no.555 green runs every few minutes from just outside the hotel.Breakfast is left in your room on a daily basis for the next morning comprising of bread,cereals,fruit,fruit juice,jams and spreads more than adequate.Ideal for families especially with young children.Beautiful views from small balcony overlooking Hyde Park,small kitchenette in room,again ideal for a young family,lovely big room with lots of space,superb!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: vittoParis
Reviews.Content: should not be considered as a hotel...but a convenient furnished flat in the center of Sydney. Rooms are large, comfortable but strict minimum. Breakfast included means : they deliver the evening before in your room some white bread (in cello wrap) instant coffee and a couple of cookies. Up to you to do with it in your room....

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Crazysteveb
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night at Hyde Park Inn based on comments on Tripadvisor. Wanted to book a second night but it was full. We stayed in a "deluxe" room and it was good - spacious and clean with a good kitchenette, dining area and a balcony with views over the park. Excellent value with a basic breakfast and car parking provided in the rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very friendly and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: clkr5320
Reviews.Content: The location of the HPI allows for easy walking to CBD attractions. The staff were very helpful and didn't hesitate allowing an early check-in after a 15 hr flight. Stayed at the start and end of a month long trip on the 10th and 12th floors. Noise not a big issue and the kitchenette was a huge plus. The only downsides: Like most hotels in Australia you must pay for internet, and the beds were a little firm. Overall, the Hyde Park Inn is good value compared to other CBD hotels, and we wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ANNGC
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is not new. There are better hotels in Sydney for the same value. Advantage has a kitchenette (for those who want to cook, which was not my case). Well located. The internet is not free and is very expensive. no restaurant and breakfast is left in the room ... and bad!.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Families!”
Reviews.Author: Family_Traveler2_IN
Reviews.Content: The family rooms in this hotel are outstanding! I traveled with my three children and we each had our own bed (one slept on the sleeper sofa). Plus, each room had a kitchnette. Breakfast is basic: cereal, choice, toast, diced peaches....but enough to get you started for the day. It is directly across from the Museum city rail (train) stop so very easy to get to. We walked to the Opera Hosue from here but it is a good walk probably 30-40 minutes. In addition, the staff was excellent. They helped with arrangements and let me print off plane tickets for free from internet room. You can't go wrong staying here with a family!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay for family”
Reviews.Author: desslock
Reviews.Content: this is one of the few hotels in sydney that could fit our family of five into one room for a reasonable price. it is located right across hyde park and the museum subway stop. the hotel and the rooms were very clean and had basic ammenities. we had one large room with 2 single beds ,a couch bed and a double.it all worked out well. the breakfast that comes with the room included some boxes of cereal,cookies,little cups of orange juice,little cans of fruit and cartons of milk. there was small balcony i enjoyed a bowl of cereal on while looking across hyde park. there are a huge number of restaurants around the corner with everything from japanese,korean,kebabs,italian,burgers.there are also a number of cafes as well as a great breakfast spot just a 1 minute walk away called cafe 255 or something like that. there is also a handy 24 hour 7- 11 next door. overall a great stay and great location with easy access to tourist areas and eateries

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: AtzeYvonne
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 3 nights in this hotel. I would rate is as a three star hotel, but at 100 euro per night at this location it was great value for money. The breakfast is included, but not much good. However, there are very many places very nearby. We had a superior room in the fourth floor. The room was very big and had a small kitchen in it. There also was a sofa. All in all very comfortable and quiet. The hotel is close to the Museum metro station and can be very easily reached from the airport. The staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Zan77
Reviews.Content: Hotel was a good price, conveniently situated on free bus route, across the road from train station, easy walking to monorail, all of attractions in Botanical Gardens. Only provides basic breakfast (cereal, toast, fruit & juice) but suited us as we did not want to waste too much time on breakfast, but get going and explore. You will need to be able to put up with some traffic noise ( mainly sirens ).

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for family with 3 kids”
Reviews.Author: familyof5_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at the hotel. The service was excellent, always friendly whenever we asked a question of where to go and how to get there. Breakfast was great for kids. Easy location to access city and transport. one of the very few hotels in sydney who cater for families with 3 children, most only allow 2 children to stay. We loved it for our stay in Sydney and would return and recommend to others. The free laundry is a great bonus for washing the kids clothes.

Reviews.Title: “Best Valued Hotel in Sydney CBD”
Reviews.Author: akirajunto
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my parents and aunts in a deluxe family room. The room was big enough for 5 of us and also there's still spaces to put our luggages.
