It was nice and clean, with towels and soap in the bathroom. The room was like you would expect to be in a 4-star hotel in general. Breakfast was good. It was not much, but enough. Two breads, milk, and processed fruits for each person. The breakfasts were put inside the refrigerator and added everyday when they clean up the room. There were also butters and jam (Thank god they gave us strawberry jam and some peanut butter, instead of vegemites). There was a kitchen equipped with cooking tools. We used to cook eggs and bacons for breakfast. Hence, we had a big breakfast for maybe $3.00 per person, instead of $15.00 like in any other hotels. The good thing about this hotel is that it is cheaper than any other 4-star hotels in Sydney CBD. Really great value for such price. The breakfasts were complementary, you don't need to pay more for breakfast. Also you can get a parking space for free, although I have heard that it was not very spacious). Complementary newspapers are sent to your room every morning. The location was great. Darling Harbour, China Town, and many other interesting places are easily reached by foot. Train station is just at the corner of the road. Makes it easy to travel from and to airport. There were some unpleasant experience from the room service, like a couple of spoons are still dirty in the kitchen and they didn't refill the soap in the bathroom. But those were not very disturbing. I still feel enjoyed staying at this hotel. Really great place with great price. Definitely will stay there if I visit Sydney again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great room. Great value.”
Reviews.Author: RichOrman
Reviews.Content: You really could not ask for a better location in Sydney. Pretty much everything you might want to see is within easy walking distance, and you are right across the street from a great park, which is essentially contiguous with the Botanic Gardens. The room was very comfortable (being from the USA, I am generally not used to hotel rooms with kitchens, so I always consider it a bonus), the bed was great, and it had a little balcony with a nice view of Hyde Park. Also the free parking garage was a great bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Not four star”
Reviews.Author: LetsDoLunch
Reviews.Content: I booked Hyde Park Inn are reading the reviews here; I think this is the only time I've ever been disappointed with a recommended hotel. First, the pros: - the location is central, and very easy to get to from the airport via the train. I arrived at the hotel maybe 25 minutes after getting off the plane. - it's pretty cheap, and they include basic breakfast provisions. And the cons: - the hotel is on a very busy main street, and the windows are not double glazed so there is a lot of traffic noise. You can even hear people having loud arguments etc. - the decor is really pretty awful. Not four star quality at all. - the cleaning leaves a bit to be desired. The floor tiles look grungy, there were stains on the bedspreads and blankets. - they don't even have individual amenities, like soap or shampoo. Just big old squeezy bottle dispenser things attached to the wall. Yes, it's pretty cheap for a city hotel. But I'd sooner pay more for a pleasant room and a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location in Sydney CBD”
Reviews.Author: Explorer60Melbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in this well-located hotel right opposite Hyde Park and Museum underground train station. It is walking distance to many of Sydney's attractions. Our room had enough beds for 4 people and a kitchen too - would be great for families travelling with children. For the price of $176 per night for a deluxe room for two of us, this is hard to beat in Sydney. We had read about some rooms being noisy - the 7th floor was OK. The view made up for the muted traffic noise from below!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families”
Reviews.Author: NickLizK
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a family room which had 3 single beds and 1 double. The kitchenette was perfect, had all we required. Check in was fast - they provided maps and details on bus stops etc... Every question I asked (where is closest supermarket etc) was always answered with a smile and then they marked it on my map for me. Bfast was provided in your fridge (bread, spreads, cereal, fruit, milk) - it was more than we needed, so we used the bread to make the kids sandwhiches for the day. Free laundry facilities were very handy, especially when travelling with young kids. Only thing that would have been good, would be baths in the bathrooms - a bath for the kids and for the parents tired muscles after sightseeing would have been great. Highly recommend the place - will definately be back. Rooms were good value for central Sydney. Position was great - close to darling harbour, china town, museums, circular key etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: bendalong
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in a deluxe studio. My room faced Hyde Park and it is a stunning view where you can see all the way to the heads in the Harbour. Room was clean and comfortable with its own small kitchen, table and chairs, couch and two beds. Bathroom was a little small and outdated but very clean. Would highly recommend if you were staying in Sydney for a couple of days or weeks as it is walking distance to the harbour and on the edge of the cbd and with the kitchenette it is perfect for making your own meals and saving a little money :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: Bubba030
Reviews.Content: I just stayed with my two daughters for three nights at this hotel. Such a great location. Clean rooms, great breakfast (more than enough each day). Yes once again you do hear the traffic a bit but I used cheap ear plugs and heard nothing & my girls slept though each night no worries. The reception staff always answered any questions we had and were more than helpful and always pleasant. I would highly recommend this hotel and for the price well worth it. I don't know what anybody would want more from a hotel. I will stay for sure when I next return.

Reviews.Title: “"Loved The Hyde Park Inn"”
Reviews.Author: teresavimini
Reviews.Content: I loved my 2 week stay at the Hyde Park Inn, and will definitely be back when I am next in Sydney. Great location, great room, and pretty good service overall. I had a deluxe studio on the top floor, with great views of Hyde Park and St Maryâ€™s Cathedral. Itâ€™s a bit noisy even that high up if you have the balcony doors open, but closed no problem, I managed to sleep well and I am a considerably light sleeper. Location was excellent, walked all over, 15 mins to Kings Cross, 15 mins to Circular quay, Chinatown is a 5 min walk away, and of course right near Town Hall station which will get you to any destination in the metro area. Breakfast is simple but adequate, and is supplied daily, toast, juice, coffee and cereal. If you want anything more substantial youâ€™re in the heart of the CBD so there is unlimited variety of cafes to eat breakfast at. Servicing of the room was good, daily clean. I would recommend this hotel to any one visiting Sydney, for the price, location and quality of service; itâ€™s one of the best in Sydney. Check it out. Thanks to Trish for taking care of my reservation and Suri for his attentiveness to my needs.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: AusBrenden
Reviews.Content: Have just returned home after a 4 night stay at Hyde Park Inn over the Easter long weekend. I had booked room many months back simply for location, but as stay got a bit closer I started to read other reviews about this hotel and thought about changing, I am so glad that I didnt change. As a regular visitor to Sydney I have stayed at many many different hotels (from 3 star to supposed 5 star), but none have ever really made me want to go back and stay there again. But this will be my preferred choice of hotel for Sydney for every trip from now on. There is not one thing that I could fault. I know other reviewers have had issues with certain aspects of this hotel, but I did not have a single problem with any aspect. The room was huge (I stayed in a Deluxe studio on level 11) was spotlessly clean,had an amazing view from balcony, was quiet (didnt hear any traffic or siren noise at night like some others had complained about), the breakfast was great, more than sufficient, got a free paper every morning (saved having to walk next door to convenience store!!) and got free parking for rental car (yes its a bit tight, but not impossible, but hey... its free, whos going to complain??!!) what more could you possibly need. Ok there is no gym or pool, but across Hyde Park on College Street, is an aquatic centre... bout a 3 min walk. Hyde Park Inn is the best value hotel I have stayed anywhere in the world, I have spent 4 times per night in other hotels compared to what I payed here and this place is far superior. Those of you looking for a clean, spacious, quiet room with great views, friendly reception staff, free breakfast, newspaper and carparking and laundry, stop wasting your time searching the net for other hotels in Sydney, because I promise you that if you book a room here you seriously will not have any regrets. I also forget to mention you get free in room movies... they give so much, but ask for very little... Give it a go..... Cant wait to go back to Sydney for no other reason but to stay here again :-)

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy With Hyde Park Inn”
Reviews.Author: Rosita
Reviews.Content: After reading the Trip Advisor reviews of this hotel, we knew this is where we wanted to stay and we weren't disappointed. We arrived early in the morning after a 14 hour flight from Los Angeles and unfortunately our room wasn't ready till 1pm, but we were offered the guest lounge where we could rest. We had asked for a room with a balcony on a higher floor and were on the 12 floor with a lovely view of the park. We stayed for 5 nights and an additional 2 nights at the end of our Australian trip; 15th floor. When we returned, we were treated like old friends. Yes, it was quite noisy, but Sydney is a busy city and it wasn't a problem, especially as we slept with the air conditioner on and therefore closed the windows. The room was basic, but very clean and comfortable. Housekeeping left extra towels when we asked for them and the front desk staff were very helpful. Loved having the kitchenette, which was very well equipped and we always had breakfast in our room. Having breakfast left in the fridge every day was a treat, although we also bought extra food from Coles Supermarket, which was just a 5 minute walk away. The pasta place at the corner looked great and there's lots of coffee shops. The location is fantastic for buses and trains - Museum Station right across the street and Central Station a 15 minute walk. We could actually walk to nearly everywhere from the hotel and were only 10 minutes from Chinatown for great restaurants. We loved the free show from our balcony each night. There's a large colony of flying foxes (huge bats) living in the Botanical Gardens and every night at dusk, they all take off and fly right past the hotel and down Elizabeth Street - I have no idea where they end up, but it was fun to watch. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a reasonably priced hotel in Sydney that is close to transportation, all the tourist sites, supermarkets, restaurants, etc.

Reviews.Title: “good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: dvdweyer
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hyde Park Inn for five nights around Mardi Gras. The hotel has a very good location for Mardi Gras and general sightseeing of Sydney. The staff is friendly and forthcoming on special requests. The rooms are OK, but not great and the central location means it can get quite noisy. A letdown was the Internet connection available: not wireless, expensive and everything other than HTTP(S) was firewalled.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable priced accomodation with friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: wilmso
Reviews.Content: Good quality accomodation with all amenities apart from dining-however b/fast provided on a daily basis-found staff very accomodating to all requests-would definitely stay again-fre laundry facilities fab-shower flow could be better

Reviews.Title: “Best value for a family of four”
Reviews.Author: Reflections
Reviews.Content: I found it very difficult to find hotels in Sydney that would accomodate more than 3 people in a room. I was very happy we booked this hotel. I booked a deluxe family studio (1 queen and 2 single beds) through the hotels website and requested a room on a higher floor due to previous reviews about traffic noise. We got a room on the 9th floor overlooking Hyde Park which is the highest floor for that room category. I'll admit, the traffic noise was a little loud (mostly from sirens), but we did need the a/c on at night, so we kept the windows closed. When the hotel makes any future renovations, I hope they will install more sound proof windows. We found a little take-away pasta place that had a great selection and good tasting food. And with the little kitchenette and the mini-breakfast provided, we were able to save some money on food and eat healthy instead of eating out all the time. Coming from Canada, Australia is very expensive! If you turn right exiting the hotel, the pasta place is right at the corner. Another good (inexpensive) place to shop for food is Woolworths. There is a free "green" bus that stops just outside the hotel which will take you directly to Sydney Harbour, but it is a nice walk if you decide to walk at least one way. We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would highly recommend it. The staff is very friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonable price, exceeded expectations.”
Reviews.Author: caf54
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by the good quality of this fairly recently renovated hotel in the heart of Sydney. Parking and breakfast were included, making the value even more appealing as prices for these 'extras' skyrocket in the city. Our room had a very workable kitchenette and a view to Hyde Park across Elizabeth Street. The room was quiet in spite of the location. The bathroom was 'like new'. Not a lot of frills, but great value for the money. One must reserve well ahead of time as word is spreading about this reinvented hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Wonderful Room”
Reviews.Author: hookem79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyde Park Inn during our stay in Sydney. We loved the hotel and the location was wonderful. It was across the street from the train station, making transportation easy. The staff was wonderful and the rooms were huge! The only complaint is that it did not have free internet access. You had to pay extra per day. Overall, it was a great room and we loved our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Fantastic Room and Relaxing View”
Reviews.Author: katieanastasia
Reviews.Content: We booked a Family room on booking.com for a reasonble price for three nights. The room holds a maximum of 5 people (queen bed, 2 single beds and a sofa bed. However, we had 6 of us 2 adults, 2 teenagers and 2 small children, 3 on the queen bed and the rest on the single beds! The room was very spacious, the bathroom was abit tradtional and the plasma was great! It gets abit noisy with traffic, sirens, etc. so, leave your door and windows closed at night! The staff were great!! The check in time is 1pm, however, we had an early flight, so we arrived at 8am. Luckily, our room was already prepared, so we were able to check in!! The location was fabulous its only 2 streets away from george st, museum station is right across the road, and only minutes from sydneys attractions!!!! The downside was that you have to pay $11 an hour to use the internet which is ridiculous! BUT, there is 2 internet cafes on liverpool street just 2 MINUTE walk, (EVERYWHERE INTERNET $ 1.50 an hr AND BLUETOOTH -24hr $3.00)!!! I would recommend this hotel for families! the rooms are GREAT!!!! LOCATION IS EXCELLENT TOO!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Spacious, Well Located, Reasonably Priced”
Reviews.Author: jjumpstart
Reviews.Content: The headline says it all. We got a reasonable rate for 2 nights on Wotif.com The room was very clean, had plenty of space, and the free "do-it-yourself" breakfast was adequate. All necessities were included: small kitchen, cooktop, microwave oven, toaster, electric jug, refrigerator, flat panel TV, etc. Free parking, free newspaper and the adjoining Italian restaurant offered a 10% discount to guests (we didn't use it). If you're travelling on a budget, the small kitchen would come in handy and you can buy all your needs from the 7-11 (about 50 metres down the road). For cheaper supplies, try Woolworths on the corner of Park & George St (opposite the Town Hall). If your looking for a cheap feed, the Pasta take-away shop on the corner of Liverpool & Elizabeth St had a huge slab of Lasagne (amongst many other choices) which fed both of us for AU$7.50 ... also, if you like good coffee, get a large size take-away from one of the 3 or 4 coffee shops closeby, drink half (store the remainder in the refrigerator) and heat the rest in the microwave the next morning for breakfast. It's not as good as fresh, but it beats that powdered stuff anyday. The bustop is virtually at the door, the train station is across the road (there's is also an entrance just around the corner in Liverpool St in case it's raining) and Hyde Park across the road is a nice place to sit and recharge the batteries. The room did smell a little stuffy when we first entered, but we didn't notice it after the first few minutes. The air conditioning worked well and at low speed was efficient and very quiet. Although we were on the top floor (the 15th), we did notice the traffice noise at night ... partularly the sirens of ambulance and fire vehicles. We didn't hear any noise from adjoining rooms. From the higher floors, the views across the park to the harbour in the distance are very relaxing! Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great staff, great rate, family friendly”
Reviews.Author: Tonganboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a studio apartment with a queen bed and a single (parents and single child). It was perfect. Perfectly located to central CBD, shops, Art Galleries and Museum, Museum Train Station is literally across the road and World Sq monorail station is just round the corner. Overlooked Hyde Park. Staff were very friendly and helpful. No complaints really. We didn't find there were any noise issues either from other rooms or from the outside. We're going back soon!

Reviews.Title: “spacious flat beware very noisy at night!”
Reviews.Author: monmonde
Reviews.Content: exellent customer service at the park inn , 2 bedroom flat is spacious , bathroom on the old side , windows need a good clean, free continental breakfast and newspaper hotel next to shops and 15mn walking distance to the Opera house taxi from airport 45$, 7/11 right next to the hotel and also a starbucks coffee shop !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Deals, Clean”
Reviews.Author: JumpJump
Reviews.Content: I visited Sydney with a close girlfriend at the end of September this year. We were looking at all the reviews on this site and were tempted by the boutique hotels at Potts Point but finally settled on a 'safer' area which was more central as well. Hyde Park Inn had some decent reviews and an easy to use website with an enquiry system that was quick to respond. Together with the reply, they offered us a discount/ free upgrade. I called the hotel to give credit card details (they offer the option of email or call..). At first they quoted the standard price but after referring them to our enquiry +discount + guest name, they gave us the same offer discount! :) The hotel itself was very clean and bright. Maximum score for location - just opposite Hyde Park and a short walk to the shopping streets of George and Pitt. If you wear good shoes, there's not a problem walking all the way to Circular Quay and Darling Harbour. In the other direction, Surry Hills is about a 10 min walk away. The central train station was about 10 minutes walk as well - saved us a train transfer (from Museum, just across the street from the hotel) to the Blue Mountains (Katoomba) Our room was decently sized and spacious - seems odd though, there are no twin bed rooms, ours was with one queen and one single bed (perhaps family oriented? changing bed size was not available). We had a tiny kitchenette with a rather measly breakfast every morning (delivered in the fridge the night before) - two slices of bread + Jam/ butter + 2 cookies + milk + youghurt. Not very much but we managed to stay slightly satisfied. The counter staff were mostly friendly 2 ladies in particular were very helpful in making and altering our reservations for dinner and lunch. Hyde Park Inn had its fair share of unfriendly and unhelpful counter staff though but that didn't spoil our trip too badly. We tried to book tickets to Wicked, but they almost refused to help us call the hotline or check online. Depends on your luck who's on duty. Another lady helped us call 3 different numbers to make a reservation for dinner. Internet is charged at a ridiculous hourly rate if you want to access it from your hotel room, but they have a 'business centre' which has 3-4 computers with internet access - daily rate of about $6 AUD. You need to get to the counter to ask them to unlock the business office for you though. The hotel has a restaurant next door to it but we weren't particularly attracted to it. Each room has a order-in directory with a ton of options, albeit abit overpriced, which we used one lazy night. I'd recommend takeaway from a proper food outlet if you haven't got the energy to go out. Great place to stay for friends or family. Next time I return though, I'd look for somewhere abit cheaper. Especially since we don't drive and don't need the free carpark.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for families”
Reviews.Author: Plainyogurt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in August, in a family room on the 10th floor. The family room consisted of one room, with 4 beds and a small kitchen area with a dining table. The room had a nice view, overlooking Hyde Park.....the location was ideal, walking distance to most of the sights, close to shopping and transportation. (We did not have a car so I can't comment on the parking). Room was clean and comfortable. We booked via wotif.com and the rate was very reasonable. Staff was helpful and friendly. Did not hear much noise from the street below (given that we were on the 10th Floor) and appreciated the laundry facilities as well. Kitchen facilities included a microwave and cooktop - the hotel is a short walk from several supermarkets, and that made it easy to stock up with groceries for our stay. I did not use the internet here, but preferred to take the short walk early in the morning to the nearest McDonald's for the free wi-fi. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel / Great Price / Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Seashark7
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all for a price that is hard to beat. The rooms where large, clean and well kept. Security is great, you have to have a room key to take the elevator to the room levels. The location is in the CBD right on Hyde Park. You can take the free bus out front to go around the City. You can get tickets for the bus that goes out to Bondi and areas further out at the store next to the hotel and catch the bus right out front. The Museum Subway station is across the street, or just around the corner is another entrance to the station. Even better you can walk most everywhere. After our 13 hour flight from LA, they gave us a room at 7am, rather than the normal check in time. NICE! Staff very helpful. I will stay here again, I wish I had known about this hotel the first time I visited. If it had Free Wi-Fi and I might have sold my house and moved in.

Reviews.Title: “Good, solid hotel in Sydney. Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: k23man
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hyde Park Inn for 4 nights in August. The hotel is located next to Hyde Park, and is in a great spot as it's within walking distance of many attractions such as Sydney Tower, Darling Harbour and Paddy's Markets and the Chinese Gardens. There is also a train station and a bus stop right outside, and the monorail is accessible only a couple of blocks away. We had a room facing Hyde Park on the 9th floor, and despite what some reviewers have said, we did not find traffic noise to be a problem. The room was very spacious, clean and modern, and included a kitchenette and bathroom. The hotel has free parking (many Sydney hotels charge a nightly rate), although as some reviewers have indicated, the parking is very tight. Nevertheless, as most things are within walking distance, we were able to leave the car in the garage for the duration of our stay in Sydney. Another great feature of the hotel is that they provide a laundry for the use of guests. This is free and was just what we needed after a week on the road. On the downside, the bed did tend to sag in the middle a little, but it wasn't too bad compared to some hotel beds we slept on during our roadtrip. Otherwise, we were impressed with the quality and spaciousness of the room. Each day, Hyde Park Inn provides a continental breakfast and newspaper for guests. We found this was a great feature and enabled us to save quite alot of money over the course of our stay. While the breakfast consisting of 2 pieces of toast, fruit juice, cereal and a tub of diced fruit was adequate, we suplemented it with some food from the nearby supermarket to add a little variety. There are heaps of restaurants and other shops within a very short walking distance. The staff were professional and courteous, although they didn't bowl us over with warmth or hospitality. All in all, Hyde Park Inn provides great value for money. You wouldn't normally expect to find a hotel in such a great location that provides breakfast and a newspaper for such an affordable price. We wouldn't hesitate to stay there again next time we visit Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Hyde Park is worth looking for”
Reviews.Author: desklampVirginia
Reviews.Content: We were a family of five, traveling to Sydney for vacation. We wanted to stay in one room, i.e. an apartment-type room. Hyde Park was well able to accommodate us. Even with three beds in the room it was reasonably comfortable for us. Everything was VERY clean. The continental breakfast was much appreciated, as well as the kitchnette set-up that allowed us to have small meals or snacks in the room. The beds were very comfortable, and we all slept through the night the first two nights. Once we were over our jet lag however, the street noise started to be a problem. There is a fire station one block away, and they seemed to be particularly busy one evening. I thought the location was great; very central. The buses make getting around Sydney very easy. The staff was very nice, and happy to help with all questions. We utilized the Laundry room and the Business (computer) center; great features to take advantage of.

Reviews.Title: “Gem in the city apart from parking”
Reviews.Author: anytimecheerful
Reviews.Content: The lobby is very small like any 3 star hotel, but this hotel got roomy guest rooms unlike your average motel. In addition, the morning park view is absolutely charming, though it's a bit noisy at night (understandable as it's right on Elizabeth Street). If you choose to live in the city, I am assuming you don't need to go to sleep at 9pm. I didn't notice if the hotel has a restaurant or not. There are a lot of nice restaurants around and walking back to the hotel after dinner is just perfect exercise. Bedding is comfy and linens are clean. Toilet is as clean as any 3 star hotels. Probably they need a patch up in a few years' time. Good Foxtel channel selection is available - which would be an advantage if you're into less Aussie mainstream sport such as soccer. Staff are professional not overly friendly. Underground parking is available but space is very tight. If your driving skills aren't great then better leave the car at public carpark nearby. You'd know what I mean when you see all the scratch marks on the walls at corners. I was very happy with my stay and looking foward to return during City to Surf!

Reviews.Title: “A Great All Rounder - Value, Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: Hutchcore
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyde Park Inn as part of a large family group on the night before my wedding in October 2007. I enquired about multiple rooms and was shown through the property by one of the friendly front of house staff before we made our booking (for ten rooms including both self contained apartments) and was offered a group discount rate without having to ask which made the booking process very manageable. The staff we dealt with at the front of house, in back office mangement and service were all very hospitable and friendly through our entire experience with them and did their best to accommodate our sometimes difficult needs. We checked in in the early afternoon and my bridesmaids and I were shown to one of the two bedroom apartments at the rear of the building. This room didn't have any windows (just a panel of glass bricks to let light in from outside) but we knew that when we booked and that is the only criticism I have - it was clean, comfortable and incredibly spacious (all much appreciated the following day where there were four of us plus make up artists, hairdressers and various family riff raff coming and going for several hours!). Being set at the rear of the building, it was also very quiet - much appreciated on the Saturday evening before my wedding! Although the Hyde Park Inn is an independent hotel the apartment layout and facilities were comparable to the Saville which is just down the road - although the rate we got at Hyde Park was about a hundred dollars a night cheaper. The rest of my extended family were staying in a variety of rooms from deluxe double rooms through to the standard family rooms with extra beds for children, and everyone found the place to be a great point from which to explore the city area. Many of them had cars and although there was a charge for parking and some of them had to park in a Hotel-owned facility further down the road because their 4WDs were too high to drive into the carpark attached to the hotel, they found the rates reasonable and access quite easy. The location of this hotel is excellent - right across from Hyde Park, as the name suggests, and within 100m walk of Museum station where you can get trains to and from the airport as well as around the CBD to take you down to Circular Quay - or you can walk, it's about twenty minutes away. It's also an easy walk to Darling Harbour (about five to ten minutes depending on your pace!) and a quick stroll up to the nightlife of Oxford Street and Kings Cross (fifteen minutes away). Despite its central location the street it is on is not rowdy at night (unlike those a block or two west) so it's quite safe for families. There's an Italian restaurant attached to the hotel but to accommodate the sometimes puerile culinary tastes of my extended family, at the recommendation of one of the FOH staff we walked down to the Crown Hotel on the corner of Elizabeth and Goulburn Streets and had a fancied-up pub meal in their upstairs dining room instead, which was great (for their tastebuds and mine and my parent's stress levels). All in all the Hyde Park Inn delivers service, value and a great location in spades. It's not a fancy hotel, but it ticks all the boxes for Sydney visitors seeking a spacious, self-contained retreat from the hustle and bustle of the CBD. If I didn't live here, I'd stay there again in an instant.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value, great service -- I'll be back!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelchicWA
Reviews.Content: We just loved staying here! The rooms are perfect for a family who don't mind all staying in the one room. If adults are looking for privacy from the kids, this isn't the place for you. The four of us found it comfortable and perfect for accessing all the sights of Sydney. The beds were comfy, there was plenty of pillows and blankets, and it was all very clean and well presented! I loved the kitchen which, while very compact, had all the necessary equipment and a fabulous view over Hyde Park! It almost made me want to cook! The continental breakfast was very adequate.... toast for 4 with a variety of spreads, 4 varieties of cereal, 4 tubs of fruit and juice, and plenty of milk. More than enough for us, and fresh every day! The location is REALLY convenient, easy access to all transport in Sydney (trains, buses, monorail), and a short walk around the corner and you are in the heart of Pitt St, with all the shops and restaurants you could ask for. Sydney is a very busy city at night and there always seemed to be a wide variety of people out and about day and night. So as a family we felt safe walking around Sydney and the hotel until quite late at night. It is located on a very busy street, walking out onto the balcony confirms that. However, the rooms were always quiet enough at night and we had no trouble sleeping. It was interesting to go out on to the balcony and see the stream of traffic and people moving through the street day and night. The view over Hyde Park was very peaceful, and I enjoyed watching all the fruit bats flying in the sky at night. Taxi from the airport cost less than $30. Thanks to all those people who recommended this hotel on TripAdvisor in the past, we booked on your recommendations and weren't disappointed at all. Overall, highly recommended, and when we return to Sydney, we'll be staying at the Hyde Park Inn.

Reviews.Title: “My Mom didn't want to leave!!!”
Reviews.Author: sweetheart76
Reviews.Content: I can't say anything better about this hotel! If my mom didn't want to leave, that's how good it was!! (mom's a super clean freak and very picky with hotels). We booked a Deluxe and requested for upper floors as I've read reviews about the noise. The room could actually sleep FIVE! There was a queen, two singles and a day bed. The washroom was spotlessly clean :) Kitchen was well-stocked, there were only three of us, and we certainly didn't need that much food ^^. The hotel is located right smack opposite Hyde Park, with the Museum station right by there, the free Sydney shuttle bus just a short walk (around 1 min) away from the hotel doors, and the bus to Bondi beach around Museum station. Internet service available just round the corner at a very affordable price! If you enjoy walking, all the attractions are not far to walk to! ;) There's also a 7-Eleven just a couple of doors away, which was God-sent for extra milk or juice, or if you are up in the middle of the night feeling hungry ;) We were given off-site parking for the first two days and basement parking for the last day... off-site parking is only about a block away. Basement parking was sooo tight but we survived! ;) If we ever come to Sydney again, there's no question that THIS would be the place where we'd stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic price backed up by outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Emuboy
Reviews.Content: Stopped for two nights in a family room with spouse and three kids facing Hyde Park. Lovely outlook. The rooms have been renovated since my last visit, and were clean and comfortable. All mod cons available, and decent contintental breakfast provided in the kitchen for us. We were on the 7th floor, the noise level was OK despite being on Elizabeth St, and the air conditioner helped to minimise. Hotel also provides a free paper for each day, which was great. Cost $225 per night for five of us including parking and breakfast, which is outstanding value in this area of Sydney. Car parking was great for small cars, not sure about the bigger models. Location is superb, around the corner in Liverpool Street is is any number of eateries and a little further to George St, less than a five minute walk for pubs and the spanish quarter. All this and a nice view of the park. Museum Station on the Cityrail is across the road, so transport is no problem. Most importantly though, I have to recommend the staff at this hotel. Every one without exception went out of their way to accommodate us, and to resolve any problems no matter how trivial. The HR section needs a pat on the back for the staff selection. This hotel is unbelievable family value in this area of Sydney, and within walking distance to most attractions. The absence of room service and a pool is a minor hardship and of little concern. Food can be easily ordered in to your door through cuisine courier from fantastic restaurants at a cost of about $6.50 and breakfast is provided. Overall, one of my favourites in the centre of Sydney to date (and I have tried many).

Reviews.Title: “Recovery from eye surgery”
Reviews.Author: ChardyTart
Reviews.Content: I had an operation on my left eye and after the operastion I had to lay face down face down for 5 days for 22 out of 24 hours. The reception staff and housekeeping staff were great and very helpful through out our stay. Housekeeping asked each day what was a convenient time for us for them to clean the room. We had travelled form the far south coast and getting free parking was an added bonus. Only downside was the traffic noise at night but we were in the heart of Sydney. Would stay again as it in the center of Sydney,

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Views”
Reviews.Author: TheFarrells
Reviews.Content: Cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. Good correspondence before booking and very helpful reception staff to make sure we got the best two room deal for 2 adults and 5 children. Slight hiccup on arrival about room location, quickly resolved. Views were great. Fantastic location for city centre exploring. Rooms were clean and well equipped. Only downside was a window was replaced with a screen in both rooms which did allow some street noise into the sleeping areas, but after 20hours travelling did not seem to bother us to much. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent apartment and great location.”
Reviews.Author: Wandering2
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for 15 nights early March and had a fantastic time. Staff extremely helpful & friendly, nothing was too much trouble. They let us have our room soon after arrival even though we arrived early in the morning. Room very spacious & clean. View over Hyde Park nice. Museum Station virtually across the road. Breakfast ample and good plus saved us having to go find breakfast each morning. Room cleaned daily. Huge benefit for us was washer/dryer facilities as only had 20kg baggage allowance - and you know us girls!! Stored our baggage until early evening on the last day for us no problem. All in all we couldn't have picked a better place to stay whilst in Sydney to get married and wouldn't hesitate to reccomend the Hyde Park Inn to people.

Reviews.Title: “great location and nice room”
Reviews.Author: kathyhu
Reviews.Content: W enjoyed our stay here, the location is good and the room was good also, not the best place I have stayed but for the price of accommodation in Sydney and the location we were happy. I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great for 3 people on a budget and in need of space & a great location!”
Reviews.Author: sj1923
Reviews.Content: 1) The location was perfect. Right in Hyde Park (about 8-10 blocks from the Harbour) and next to the free bus that takes you directly to Circle Quay. There was even a wine festival at the park across the street when we arrived! 2) The staff are pretty helpful, not the friendliest, but know how to direct you around the city, give you maps and highlight areas to visit and the best method of reaching them etc. 3) The rooms I found very large - with 3 beds, a small couch, desk, kitchenette and large marble bathroom. The beds were pretty comfortable as well. I found the hotel (aside from the lobby) very clean and well kept. 4) Breakfast was provided daily. This was a great help to the budget. Breakfast included: cereal, milk, toast (white or wheat), fruit juice, diced fruit, coffee and tea. It was more than enough to fill you up - although not everyone likes that for breakfast, it was perfect for me and my group. 5) There was a restaurant on site, but I never went - there are too many other great places in Sydney to try...I suggest going elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at Hyde Park Inn”
Reviews.Author: JP1
Reviews.Content: Mu husband and I stayed at the Hyde Park Inn Feb 17th - 23rd 2009. We had a deluxe studio on the 12th floor which more than met our needs. Large spacious room, with kitchenette & table, 2 comfy chairs, adequate wardrobe space and nice bathroom. Breakfast provided daily in the fridge, although limited, was a bonus and meant you didn't have to go out for breakfast. Free use of washing facilities and dryers was great. Rooms were cleaned daily. Location was brilliant, directly across the road from Museum Station and the bus stops. Would definitely stay there again when in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Jacquio
Reviews.Content: Apart from good location - very bare package def not worth price. Main facilities are they but hotel seriously lacks on hygiene. Walls dirty, corrisdors were dark and grim, carpet and bed linen worn and generally very dismal atmosphere but the cockroach on the last day confirm it....the place is manky! Breakfast is very cheap and basic too! Stay in a Hostel - much better value for money! At least no roaches either! :(

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Member From Shellharbour Australia
Reviews.Content: We usually go to Sydney once a year for opera in the park, and chose the Hyde Park Inn to stay in this year. I would not call the Hyde Park Inn a budget hotel. There are other cheaper hotels within a few blocks but the ones we have stayed at are not nearly as nice and charge extra for parking. This is a good mid-range property with a lower mid range rate compared to other hotels in the area. The location is excellent. It feels more like a very nice motel (I think they are really serviced appartments) rather than a hotel, but we were very comfortable, didnt need anything overly fancy, and had no major complaints at all. We had a deluxe studio room on the 15th floor facing the park. The room was furnished with one queen and one single bed. It was clean, not huge but big enough and nicely appointed with a small kitchen, Air Con and satellite TV. Basic breakfast supplied and parking available as part of the room rate (this must be prebooked as spaces are limited). Other budget hotels charge extra for parking, so if you have a car, the Hyde Park Inn offers even better value. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Have been reports about traffic noise at this property, but given the excellent location right down town, Im afraid it comes with the territory to some degree in this price range. We did not find it to be much of a problem. It may help to stay as high in the building as possible, but we have found that all the properties we have stayed at in this area have the same problem to some degree or another. Fortunately for us, we can usually manage not to notice traffic noise too much. If you are on a very tight budget and not too bothered with a few extras, and dont need parking, then the Hyde Park Inn is probably not a good choice, as it is better than a budget hotel and likely to be a bit out of your price range. (Try the YWCA or Travelodge Wentworth in the same general area...the Hyde Park Plaza is a gamble and parts of it are tired looking). However, if you dont mind paying a little more than a budget rate, if you like a great location, in a nice place, with a few extras (like car parking included in the rate, etc) without breaking the bank, then the Hyde Park Inn may suit you. We were quite happy here and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for NYE”
Reviews.Author: cornishtim
Reviews.Content: Good, clean and secure hotel for a central location at a relatively good price. Great location right opposite Hyde Park (as the name suggests!); however traffic noise could be a problem for some light sleepers. Breakfast is basic (bread, juice, yoghurt, etc) but an added bonus in my eyes and better than nothing. There are lots of food stores nearby (7-eleven next door, and Woolworths only 10mins away) so you can't complain really. There's a bottle-shop about 4 mins away too. Good kitchen area if you like cooking in your bedroom (not for us really). We chose this hotel for a 5-night stay over NYE and it was perfectly fine. We had a friend to stay one night, so the extra single bed was great for it. Sure it's not going to win any design or quality awards (you'll have to pay top money for this in Sydney), but for the average tourist or business traveller it is absolutely ideal. Having read other reviews it seems that you need a room overlooking the park, but think that there must be only one or two rooms on each floor (17 from memory?) that this applies to.

Reviews.Title: “Is this backpacking!?!”
Reviews.Author: Deptford-bill
Reviews.Content: Having backpacked my way round the world many times I know that Christmas can be either brilliant or terrible when away. My wife and I were fortunate to travel the world for 11 months during 06/07. As this was my wifes first real experience of 'back packing' I decided to dig deep and book us into the hotel over Christmas and New Year - 06 in to 07. The staff at the hotel were brilliant, always helpful and friendly, that included everyone from the genuinely lovely cleaning staff to the various managers we encountered. We had a two bedroom suite and having booked well in advance I managed to get a very good deal. It had a well equiped kitchen, air con, balconies with excellent views, comfortable bedrooms, clean bathrooms and to top it all the hotel staff had put a full size, decorated Christmas tree in the room - a really nice touch. After a lot of hard, rough, travelling to come across this type of 'luxary' was fantastic - that combioned with the easy nature of the hotels staff helped to make our stay very, very memorable. We stayed there for a further 4 days in April 07 as our trip drew to an end. From a travellers point of view the hotel is not cheap, but if you are able to cut back in other areas and dig a bit deeper in your pockets it really is worth it for a special occassion. Would I recommend it, without doubt - enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “NIce stay, no problems.”
Reviews.Author: diver19
Reviews.Content: We had 4 family member sharing a room, which was great as the room had a double bed and two twins, which is exactly what we needed. We booked well in advance and the hotel gave us exactly what we asked for: non smoking, high up and hyde park view with a balcony. We were on the 9th floor and you could still hear sounds of the city, but it was not enough to bother any of us. The front desk staff was helpful the whole stay, would hail cabs and book tours. The hotel was a really nice location, plenty to do and see within a few blocks. Was also very easy to catch buses and train from the hotel to get to farther places. The hotel itself was well kept up. The room was basic, but very clean and had everything we needed. A small but easy to use kitchenette with sink, microwave, oven/stove and small fridge. I wish the balcony had a couple of chairs to sit in though, but maybe they wouldn't fit, it was not a huge balcony. The beds were comfy, the bathroom was nice. Really we had no complaints. There was a free newspaper and free laundry facilities, which was great! I would definitely recommend this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Hyde Park Inn, Good Family Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: DesperadoNthQld
Reviews.Content: We spent lots of time researching our stay in Sydney as we had only ever stayed without our three kids (15,12,10) Hyde Park Inn turned out to be a great choice, the rooms have been tastefully refurbished and ours was situated on the 11th floor so traffic noise was not an issue. The kitchenette was very capable with a twin hotplate cooktop and microwave etc. The continental breakfasts were supplied to our room each afternoon and were more than ample for five of us, in fact we always had some left each day. The position with the Liverpool Street Monorail Station 5 mins walk, Museum Rail Station 1 min walk and internet cafes everywhere was good also. We also prebooked a car space (no charge) and the Staff were always friendly and helpful. Darling Harbour was a pleasant walk as was the City Centre. Just a note for families, if you want to travel on Monorail etc get a day or multiday pass, ours only cost $54.00 for a 3 day Light Rail / Monorail pass (they let us have the family 2 adults 2 kids pass even though we have 3 kids) One thing to remember if you are going to Taroonga Zoo, TAKE YOUR OWN FOOD! paid a small fortune for our food there and had to throw it in the bin, discusting. The Zoo itself was great beside that though. In all we had a great time and will stay at Hyde Park Inn next time for price, comfort and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: gilly2212
Reviews.Content: To all of you poor ostracised smokers out there, this is that rarest of gems, a hotel which has smoking allowed rooms - in fact, the whole of the 13th floor - but so well done there's not a whiff of smoke anywhere!. I stayed here for 4 nights in a de -luxe studio on the 13th floor for $159 per night. The room was lovely, smart and very clean, with an excellent bathroom and well equipped kitchenette and flat screen T.V. The beds (1 queen and 1 single) were comfortable, and there was a great view over the park and across to the bay from the balcony. A very basic breakfast was included - 2 slices of bread, cereal milk, juice, fruit + jam, and a morning paper. However, I was quoted $14 for an extra breakfast if a friend came to stay for the night, which was expensive, as was the internet at $11 per hour. There are several food stores just around the corner (and a couple of internet cafes for $2 per hour), and a good selection of shops and cafes at the world centre a few minutes walk away. Museum station can be accessed just around the corner, so you don't have to cross the street, and is only 2 stops from the airport and 2 from Circular Quay . The staff were unobtrusive but very pleasant and helpful, soon sorting out a theatre booking I'd messed up, and the hotel laundry was free to use. The only downside to my stay was the traffic noise, unavoidable even at this level, but Sydney has to bee the noisiest city I've stayed in - beloved of boy racers in souped up cars.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: doublezeezee
Reviews.Content: When I was reviewing around for hotels in Sydney city, I found that they were all not very cheap (probably as Sydney is the most popular city in Australia). I called a few hotels in Sydney and the cheapest I found for a triple share room was another hotel that was going for $AUD180 a night. I decided to go with Hyde Park Inn which was $AUD192.50 a night for triple share as the location and quality seemed better from the reviews that I read. The great thing about Sydney is the airport is not too far away from the city, so it didn't cost that much for a cab to/from the hotel. The hotel is centrally located in the CBD and when we arrived, they upgraded us from the triple share room to the family studio for no extra charge! (The front desk staff looked at the 3 of us with all our luggage and decided we deserved a bigger room! How lovely). The family studio was awesome, a balcony overlooking the lovely green Hyde Park, a fully equipped kitchenette with stove, microwave, and cooking utensils and comfy bathroom. We had a nice big TV, plenty of space, and 3 beds; a double and two singles. We also had a big sofa which was probably a bed made to look like a sofa, so it could've been a bed comfortably. So a family of five could've fit nicely with no problems. There was a 7-Eleven just outside the hotel (you don't even need to cross a street) so we bought eggs and cooked ourselves breakfast in the morning. Also they give you a free breakfast but they actually stock it in your room so you don't need to go down to their restaurant to dine! They provided milk, juice, bread slices, cereal and your basic tea and coffee all in the comfort of your own room! Some relatives came to visit us in our room and we ordered pizza in and had plenty of space to fit everyone in. We even had a little dining table in our room. Location was excellent, right in the middle of the city and facing the lovely park. We walked everywhere we needed to get to, there are public payphones and bus stops just in front of the hotel, and lots of places to eat. Staff weren't the most friendly but honestly we loved Sydney and our room too much to notice! Their internet service seemed a bit expensive when we asked about their in-room rates, so they recommended their cheaper option which was to go to their business centre and use the internet there (if I'm not mistaken it was about $AUD5 per session at the business centre). Connection speed was great, you can use one of their computers in the business centre or plug your own laptop in. They also had a printer if you needed to use one. Obviously we were so happy to receive the upgrade, but it still was the most expensive hotel we stayed at throughout our trip (Our trip lasted 17 days, we stayed at 3 locations in Queensland and one in Melbourne, all at an average of AUD$165 a night). Nevertheless, it WAS the nicest hotel we stayed at throughout our trip. I don't suppose accommodation in Sydney is very cheap anyway so it really was worth the money, but I can't help but think that 5-star hotels in Malaysia are so much cheaper than Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: PerthLovetotravel
Reviews.Content: The only bad thing was that we were only staying 1 night on route from Canberra to Perth. Room 902 on the 9th floor. Great view. Huge room. Well stocked kitchenette with everything from water bottle to salt and pepper shakers. Fabulous breakfast ready for you to prepare in your room at your leisure. Little packets of biscuits with your tea and coffee sachets. Gorgeous bathroom with soaps/ shampoos etc on the wall and little packets of shower caps. We had the third person and we actually didn't have to ask for their towel etc like you normally do, it was all there waiting. Complimentary Newspaper in the morning by your door. Lovely staff, looked after our luggage after we checked out. LCD tv on the wall.Free foxtel and movies etc. Opposite Museum train station and walking distance to most places. Bus stop next to train station (got that to the footy). We could not find a fault with it and will certainly be staying there again next time......and for longer.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: NJCricketer
Reviews.Content: Central location - best way to explore Sydney - walking distance from all trains, attractions. Ask for higher floor. In room breakfast replenished every day - good for family with older children. Good value for money. Small kitchenette. Free laundry facilities (except detergent) helps at the end of an extended stay in Sydney. If traveling to other cities and returning back, they will store luggage for you. Polite staff (Suri was particularly helpful). Book Taxi for airport thru reception rather than trying to get one at rush hour NJ, USA

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Opp Beautiful Hyde Park”
Reviews.Author: tccfairmont
Reviews.Content: Hotel faces the beautiful Hyde Park. Walking distance to Chinatown (10 mins) & Pitts St Mall (10 mins). Very near to Museum subway station. Try to get the deluxe room, which has slightly larger kitchen & nicer furnishing. The good thing about this hotel is that it provides breakfast (cereal, bread, milk, juices, etc) in the frig for guests to consume. So you can slowly eat your breakfast in your room while enjoying the beautiful view of hyde park. The only problem we encountered in this hotel is the car park. It has limited lots & you need to reserve them while doing your booking with the hotel. You need to check-out by 10am.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain price for quality with central location”
Reviews.Author: narla20
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 weeks here on business. Had a spacious deluxe room, recently renovated. Most comfortable, with own kitchenette, free In-house DVD movies, breakfast ingredients inclusive of tariff, free underground carpark, complimentary daily newspaper, great park and skyline views. Subway is across road, city shops, restaurants all a short walk away, as is Chinatown, Darling Harbour, markets. Have stayed here before. I would not consider staying anywhere else if a city location is required.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in heart of city”
Reviews.Author: MagellanMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Have just got home from staying a few days in this hotel and absolutely loved it. The room was spacious and has obviously been recently renovated. The furnishings are very comfortable and their placements are well thought out. Having a kitchen is a fantastic bonus. They provide you with complimentary basic breakfast ingredients each day which you can prepare at your leisure in your own room. Much better than having to deal with other hotel guests early in the morning in a hotel dining room. They also provide you with a complimentary newspaper delivered to your room each morning which is a nice touch. Sitting there eating my brekky, reading the paper and looking at that amazing view was my favourite part of each day. I asked for a room that was on a high floor (after reading on here about street noise) which they gave me. So noise was not an issue. You can still here the city rumbling below you (remember though that you are staying in the middle of Australia's largest and busiest city) but with the door to the balcony shut I could hardly hear any noise at all. The view from the balcony is excellent and I spent quite alot of time out there watching the goings on of the city below me. This is a very central hotel to the city. "Museum" railway station is right across the road so getting around is very easy. You could even just cross the road and walk through Hyde Park into the city in no time at all. I bought a "Daytripper" travel pass from the railway station for $16 AUS which gives you unlimited travel on trains, buses and ferries for the day which was great value and means there is no where in the city you can't get to. The room has a brand new LCD TV with all the local TV stations plus cable stations Sky News, BBC news, Fox 8, History channel and a couple of sport channels. They also have 2 free movie channels with movies playing 24hrs which is great. This hotel is fantastic value for money. With added extras that other hotels charge you big bucks for. Last time I was in Sydney I stayed on the other side of Hyde Park at the Marriott and they charged so much more for the same thing (and breakfast was not included). The staff at Hyde Park Inn are alot more friendly than those at the Marriott too. Security was excellent as you have to use your room keycard in the elevator to acess your floor. Without it the lift won't work. A previous reviewer on this site noted that that elevator was waiting renovation, well it has been done now and both elevators were working perfectly when i was there. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for fantasic value (my room was $150AUS a night) a great hotel room with balcony and fantastic views, and a great central location to go exploring the city in.

Reviews.Title: “Like a comfortable updated slipper”
Reviews.Author: TerryCanuck
Reviews.Content: Fourth time staying at this smaller boutique hotel. We were 2 couples this time, and stayed for 6 nights in one of the upper floor, 2 bedroom, one bathroom (full bathtub and separate shower), newly renovated, suites. For $302- Aus per night, we felt that, given location, size of suite, furnishing and finishes, that we received great value. Had originally planned to stay in Meriton World Tower, but with negative Trip Advisor warnings of late night partying, and their no-cancellation policy, we decided to return to tried and true. Spectacular unobstructed views of Hyde Park from our two balconies. With sliding doors closed and quiet split air conditioners running, we did not notice an over-abundance of noise that others have mentioned. However, noise might be more evident in lower floors. Much upgrading and refurbishment has taken place over the past few years, and room renovation now seems to be at an end. However, prudence dictated that the 2 elevators (basic interior but worked fine) be renovated last, and it seems that now is the time for this to begin. One elevator was down when we visited, although given the smaller size of this hotel, it never posed a problem. However, be aware that one of two elevator renovations is likely now in full swing, and you might want to ask about this when reserving. Staff always pleased to answer questions. Would most definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mandeville-travels
Reviews.Content: Very much a mixed bag. Exceptional views over Hyde Park and toward St Marys and the Harbour were coupled with very tired decor and noisy air conditioners and cleanliness problems. It was disappointing to find a dirty dishtowel and cleaning equipment left in the room after one morning'sdubious 'cleaning' and an unmade bed. On the plus side, the location is great, in walking distance of many attractions and not too far to the harbour. I had very little to do with the staff,but such interactions were polite and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Decent City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: morevish
Reviews.Content: We, a family of 2 adults and 2 children, stayed 4 nights in a family apartment. The room is pretty decent: ample space, 1 double bed and 2 single beds, as wellas a small but adequate kitchen. The hotel is good basis to explore the city, the hotel is quite central and opposite Museum railway station. Staff is ok, not overly friendly but still service-minded. No complaints. In-room breakfast is basic: a few slices of bread, orange juice, milk and some jam/honey. Would recommend this place for visitors wanting to explore Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “City Centre Luxury”
Reviews.Author: marabooka
Reviews.Content: Central, very well equipped affordable deluxe studio with kitchen. Staff, facilities, welcome all exemplary. Continental breakfast provided in the room. All superb in a city centre hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: PerthMishelle
Reviews.Content: My two teenage children and I shifted to the Hyde Park Inn after spending a week in unsatisfactory accommodation elsewhere. From the moment we entered the lobby the experience was a complete contrast to our previous one. The staff were friendly, helpful and keen to oblige. They insisted on helping us carry our bags to the room, and popped in a few minutes after we checked in to ensure everything was okay. The room, with kitchenette, was very well appointed, tastefully decorated, comfortable, very clean and beds were quality. The bathroom was lovely, and exceptionally clean with all the necessities provvided. We had an upper level room with balcony, and loved being able to pop out to absorb the city atmosphere. After the first day the city noise became quite soothing, almost 'background' noise. Having a continental breakfast provided was a bonus, with cereal, toast, fruit and juice, a more than adequate start to each day. As we stayed a week we cooked some basic meals in the room and found the utensils provided to be adequate. There is a Coles and number of seven elevens just moments away to provide any supermarket needs. The flatscreen tv and free movie channel was a bonus for the end of day when needing to unwind. Having family I utilized the free on site washing machines and dryers, and despite being peak tourist time I never had to wait to access them. I was further impressed by the level of security and 24 hour reception, which many places I've stayed has lacked. Traveling with teenagers, and being a woman, this gave me an added sense of security. The location was perfect for staying in Sydney. An abundance of restaurants are within a small radius of the hotel. All the major city attractions were a short walk away, and for those who are unable or not wishing to walk, there is a fantastic public service network at the doorstep. At no time did I feel unsafe in the vicinity of the hotel at night. I highly recommend the Hyde park Inn and will be using it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Tanray
Reviews.Content: Our family of five stayed in a Family Deluxe room on the 13th floor for 6 nights in January. The room was spacious enough for the five of us albeit one large room. It was clean with modern furnishings. The room was serviced daily with fresh towels and beds made. The room was air conditioned and had a small balcony. The street noise can be a bit loud, so we opted for air conditioning on and balcony door closed. However, a great view looking over Hyde Park was very nice. A light continental breakfast ( and morning paper) was supplied daily to our room and was more than enough to start the day. As the room was equipted with cooking facilities we could have made a hot breakfast. The staff were very helpful and always had a smile when coming and going from the hotel. As far as location goes, it was perfect.. A 5 minutt walk to Pitt St. 15 min walk to Circular Key, 1 min to bus and train stations. Internet cafe just around the corner. An added bonus was that we were able to park the car in their under building car park at no extra cost. Would highly recommend this hotel for families and will definately be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: sportygalaus
Reviews.Content: Fantastic, clean, convenient hotel that provides extras that all other city hotels charge big dollars for. We had a family room (1 queen and 2 singles) and it included a kitechenette, flat screen TV, air con, big bathroom and very comfy beds. Parking was already booked out so we were given a voucher to park at the marriott across the road and it was free - very rare in Sydney city. Location is fantastic. We were in Sydney to see a show at the Opera House and as this hotel is directly across the road from the Museum train station, we caught the train to Circular Quay. Took max 5 minutes and cost $3.60. Price included a light continental breakfast that consisted of bread, cereals, juices and tinned fruits. The only thing I could fault this hotel on would be the noise. Elizabeth St is very busy, especially in the mornings with all the buses so best to keep your balcony door closed and take ear plugs if you are particularly sensitive to noise at night.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent Stay”
Reviews.Author: eonnee
Reviews.Content: Positives: The rooms are very large and clean. They come with kitchenettes which include a stove, microwave and a fridge. In the fridge there are complimentary juices, package fruits and bread for breakfast. There are also forks, spoons, plates, frying pans and a water steamer for tea. The view is very nice. The bathroom is also clean and comes with all the proper things. You are also alloted a parking space if you have a car (I do not recommend driving in Sydney). The beds are very comfortable. The hotel is very "homey". It is a comfortable place to stay in. The desk clerks do not really bother you but say hello and smile when you walk in. Also included is a flat screen T.V.. There are a lot of channels, but what I liked the most is the "Box Office" channel that offered new movies that are on DVD for free. I was sick for a day and a half during this trip, so the movies really made me feel at home. The hotel is very centrally located to the subway (on same block or across the street) that connects you to all the main attractions. On the same block there is also a a bus stop that connects you with all the main buses that can take you all over the city. There is a also a Seven-Eleven store two doors towards Liverpool street where you can buy inexpensive dinners (noodles, beef pies) and bus/subway tickets (I suggest buying the "Red Ticket", you can use this ticket for a week on all the subways and buses that are in the Sydney Area but won't work on the Ferries). It is also two blocks from the Monorail, two blocks from the Spanish Corrider, a block from China Town and across from Hyde Park. Also included is air condition. Negatives: The hotel is on a major street (Elizabeth Street) which can get quite noisy during the day. If you close your door to the balcony, your room becomes very quiet. The hotel offers Internet Via Ethernet wire (no wireless) for 22 Aus dollars a day. I bought it for two days because I was sick but around the corner on Liverpool Street there is a internet shop that offers internet for 1 hour for 3 Aus. Dollars. Other then that, I had a great stay. Very Central Location. Very comfortable and "Homey". Sidney is a very "Metro" City and quite busy. I suggest heading North for day trips to Manly or going taking bus rides and getting lost in the outer Sydney. I hope you have a great time! Oh, if you are heading to this hotel from the Airport, just take the green line towards the city and get off on Museum Station and your at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Take your ear plugs”
Reviews.Author: tongi
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend in a deluxe room. The fairly spacious room was renovated in neutral tones - but not sure about the bathroom, although it was fine (shower only). There was a kitchenette. The problem was NOISE. Sydney is a bus town and the hotel is on a MAJOR BUS ROUTE, so from early in the morning there is traffic noise, which made taking in the view of the park from the balcony unpleasant (we were six floors up) at any time except late at night. On our final morning (a Monday) there was hammering and banging from 8am on the floor directly above us, which made staying in our room and having a leisurely light (and they really do mean "light") breakfast impossible. When we phoned reception and made the (quite reasonable) request that the noise/vibration should cease until after checkout time their response was that the website says there are renovations going on. What it actually says is: "As this is a soft refurbishment disruption to guests should be minimal. Working on one floor at a time this work will be finished in late 2007" - not sure what they define as "minimal". It was a small thing, but I had a blister sore on my heel and got a bit of blood on the bedsheet, which wasn't changed. Not a big deal, but it shows lack of attention to detail. Otherwise, the location is good (in CBD and close to Oxford St) and there's coffee opposite in an outdoor park cafe, which you'll probably need after the (lack of) breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “disapointing...will give HPI a miss next time”
Reviews.Author: bored1985
Reviews.Content: Have been trying to get down to sydney for ages...Hyde Park Inn kept saying they had no rooms left. I looked at Wotif...and there seemed to be plenty of room. Booked parking, told it wouldn't be a problem, then when we arrived at 7.30 at night, found we had to park over at the Marriott, and walk back in the dark and the rain...not happy jan. Carpark is way too small, i could barely fit my Corolla in the carparks. Staff were rude at the front desk, even though i had already paid and they had my credit card details, i still had to leave a cash deposit. Room was noisy because of the renovations. Paint cans/wood/tools were left in hallway, and I almost tripped over. I had to keep getting our cards for the room and elevator re-set, as they only seemed to last one trip up or down the elevator. Have stayed here before with no probs, but next time i think i'll give it a miss and stay somewhere else for the same $$$

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: WinnieP
Reviews.Content: This is a terrific hotel and the location is fantastic! We stayed there for about a week when visiting Sydney. We arrived late in the evening and the moment we stepped in the lobby, the staff knew who we were and were waiting with prepared paperwork and room keys! This means they took note of my expected arrival time and check-in was a breeze! I had asked for a baby cot in advance as I was travelling with my 5 mth old baby and found everything to be fantastic. We were given a family room with a queen and 2 singles. Becos the cot was a "playpen" type, we decided to join the 2 single beds and put our baby to sleep in it. The room was one of the recently refurbished ones and had a great view of Hyde Park. The kitchenette really came in handy for us as we needed to sterilise bottles and prepare baby food. Staff were always friendly, greeting us and our baby. They also provided useful information on how to get to places. We could walk to most places in the city and other places were just a short bus-ride away. You can buy bus tickets at the 7-11 shop next door. There is also a train station "Museum station" rite at the doorstep. Would certainly stay there again in future visits! Definitely value for money!

Reviews.Title: “would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: sleepyh
Reviews.Content: we stayed 3 nights at the Hyde Park Inn in Feb 2007 as part of our round the world honeymoon. We were upgraded to a larger room with a kitchen, sofa and table & chairs which we really appreciated. The room was nice and quite roomy - the decor was a bit tired but they were in the process of updating the rooms on the lower floors at the time. It was too noisy to have the window open long but the air con made it nice and cool anyway even though it was boiling outside! the staff were really really helpful, felt really well looked after. The location was great and we were able to explore the whole city on foot from kings cross to darling harbour. There was no bar or restaurant but there was so much on the doorstep in didn't matter in the slightest. After so long away from home we really appreciated the kitchen area and sofa to relax!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Grandad_Gaz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Hyde Park Inn regularly over the last five years. It is an excellent 3/4 star hotel, the rooms are spacious and well kept, and the staff have almost always been friendly and helpful. Take a room above the 5th floor if you can as there are small balconies with beautiful views over Hyde Park. The lower floors have no balcony. There is on site parking which will save you money if you have a car, but it is limited so be sure to tell the staff when booking that you need a parking space. The prices have been quite reasonable over the time and the only reason we didn't stay there last time we were in Sydney is because it was fully booked. It also has a conference room if you are planning a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Yorkshireman25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights when we first arrived in Australia and found it to be great value. Yes the decor is a tad dated but the room was spotlessly clean and we had everything we needed including a cute continental breakfast in our fridge every morning. The hotel is probably a little bit outside the main tourist area in that it is a 25 minute walk to the bridge and opera house. Also there are not particularly any restaurants in the immediate vicinity but then Sydney is a beautiful city to walk around so it didnâ€™t really matter.
